story:
While we enjoy access to education and health services, freedom to choose a partner, build a family and determination our own futures, many others live without these choices. While we enjoy our tea and cake, many girls are married off at an early age and lose their opportunities to pursue their own futures, higher education and careers. While we can decide what is best for our children, some mothers never live to see their children grow-up.

For most of us, rights are things we take for granted, we believe we were born with certain rights and that these can not be taken from you. However, for many others even basic rights are something they still need to fight for and to seize.

Is it true that the world is worth living in? Is it true that freedom, knowledge and life are precious for all of us? If you believe in giving others the tools to improve their own lives, help us make these satellite workshops happen!

THE SAMSARA SATELLITE WORKSHOPS

This program will disseminate information and raise awareness relating to Sexual Health and Reproductive Rights in Sulawesi. In particular we will conduct sex education workshops and disseminate information about the right to safe abortion and how to access this in Indonesia – via our hotline. Our previous satellite workshop was a great success - we went to Bali, Lombok, Flores and Kupang. The biggest achievement of this workshop series was bring safe abortion into the public dialogue which led to the process  of sharing information even in a very conservative social and religious context. We also succeeded in sharing skills and mapping issues surrounding SRHR in the region. 

THE NEED

Sex education is non-existent in the Indonesian education system and access to information about reproductive health and rights, such as family planning, use of contraception and understanding of STIs, such as HIV and AIDS, is limited (and where available is often only on offer to married women). Woman who experience unplanned pregnancy are often are forced into marriage, fired from their jobs, expelled from university or school and cut off by their families and partners. As a result many of these women seek illegal, often unsafe abortions. An estimated 2 million illegal abortions take place in Indonesia every year, the majority of these are unsafe. It is not known how many woman die as a result of complications after unsafe abortion. However, one woman dies every hour from pregnancy or birth related incidents in Indonesia - it is estimated that 13% of these deaths are a result of unsafe abortions. This situation is particularly bad in Sulawesi. As a result Samsara has identified Sulawesi as the target region for this year's 6 week long satellite workshop program.  

WHERE YOUR MONEY WILL GO

We need $3000 to pay for 15 workshops over 4 weeks in Sulawesi. The money will cover the cost of the travel, food, accommodation, workshop materials and communication tools for three vibrant and passionate Samsara staff to travel and conduct workshops in Sulawesi.

THE IMPACT

Through these workshops we hope to empower youth in Sulawesi by providing them with information about their sexual reproductive health and rights. We will also disseminate our Hotline number so that woman who experience unplanned pregnancy have access to counseling and options.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

  • If you can, give money. Give as much as you can, whether that be $500 or $5. It really makes a difference. Even $5 is food for one of our team for a day! $500 will cover one team members flight costs. 
  • Spread info re: safe abortion and Samsara’s work in Indonesia and our program by sharing this campaign link
  • Join us on twitter, facebook and our website 
  • Join us along the way – recommend a place for us to conduct additional workshops or reach out to people you know along the route and ask them to provide housing, food, and offer support in any way. We will stop in at Manado, Gorantalo, Ampana, Togean, Luwuk, Kendari, Bau Bau, and Makassar.
  • Donate directly to our hotline

If you willing to donate but have no credit card, you can transfer your donation to our bank account.

Bank Name       : Mandiri

Bank Adress      : Jl. K.H Ahmad Dahlan, Yogyakarta, Indonesia.

Account Name   : Samsara

No Rekening      : 137-00-1027673-7

Swift Code         : BMRIIDJA

If you send donation via bank account please confirm us at samsara.indonesia@gmail.com or +62-274 6686120 so we can keep you updated.

story:
WHAT is FitFriend?

FitFriend is bringing old Sportswatch behaviour to the iPhone. While in addition, bringing you new ways to map out runs, train in increments, and eventually coaching. 

Something got lost in translation in porting the first wave of apps from that Garmin or Timex watch that you traditionally used, to the mobile device. Essential functionality such as "laps" were missed out on, while at the same time non-essential functionality such as "badges" or whatever added to the clutter. 

You may have switched from your watch to your mobile device to log your workouts. Then switched back, because you found your watch is still better. Or you haven't switched back, but you're left wishing the mobile captured the kind of training your watch captures. You don't know whether you're missing out on more, by using a watch or a mobile.

This is because the current crop of running apps are cluttered, and irrelevant to runner's needs.

Runners still use their watches over apps, and for a good reason. Because the watch tracks times relevant to the variety of training that you get from any good running program. Runners are still choosing to use their watches, for training such as "intervals", "hills", "tempo", "fartlek". This has to change, the world has gone mobile now.

FitFriend is bringing old reliable behaviour + new intuitive behaviour, to the mobile.

 

WHO We Are

Currently a 1-man shop, Mike Post is founder and CTO. Seeing as it's just me at the moment, I'm going to switch from the 3rd person now :) I come from 3 backgrounds - running, music & audio engineering, and computer engineering.

Running competitively as a teen in orienteering, and for my high school track & field team, training has been a part of my life in some way for almost 2 decades.

Playing music was also a big part of my life as a teen, and I studied the technology side of it at university for 3 years in my twenties. Not having enough of university, or technology, I returned 2 years later to study computer engineering. I've been working as a software engineer for almost 5 years now, mainly in mobile apps.

Sometimes you get a calling though, when you realise that something isn't as good as it could be - and that brings us to where we are now. Using my experience in running and engineering, to bring you kickass products. To me, quality matters most - that's going to be reflected in FitFriend products.

 

WHAT We Need

Your contributions, and your passion, to help drive this forward. Most of the engineering work has been completed for the initial release on iOS, and is currently entering beta testing. Choose 1 of the following perks to your right, from Spectator, Casual, Active, Competitor, or Olympian.

Funding will be directed to the incomplete work, for the initial iPhone release. in order of priority:

- Graphics

- Feature enhancements 

- iOS7 support

- Marketing / Advertising 

If the amount raised surpasses the goal of $5000, and reaches $10,000 the additional funding will be directed to future expansion:

- Pebble integration

- Coaching services

- Servers and iCloud integration

If the amount raised surpasses $20,000, the additional funding will be directed to the next line of future expansion:

- Blackberry10 release

- WP8 release

- Android release

 

LONGTERM

When things get crazy and we eventually have a large amount of funding available, there are some new types of hardware products in the pipeline, that will turn the way you do workouts upside down. 

 

PROMOTION

Can't offer funding? Or merely want to help out more? No problem - you can do that AND we can even give you something in return! 

All you need to do is to dress as a giant chicken and stand on a street corner, for 100 hours. Kidding! Instead, share the campaign using the share tools above. 

We'll give $200, to the person whose sharing, has led to the most amount of contributions. Ok? So anyone who logs into Indiegogo, and shares the campaign on Twitter, Facebook, or elsewhere, qualifies for this $200 prize! But only if you log into Indiegogo - otherwise we have no way of tracking you.

NOTE: I have to give credit to Tracy McMillan here for the same kind of promotion in Localeikki's excellent recreation database app :) If you're feeling extra generous, you can fund that here too.

 

Thank you for listening. We promise you that FitFriend will be a lot more exciting than this boring chunk of text you just read through. Stay tuned for more updates, by following us on Twitter or Facebook!
story_txt:
WHAT is FitFriend?
FitFriend is bringing old Sportswatch behaviour to the iPhone. While in addition, bringing you new ways to map out runs, train in increments, and eventually coaching. 
Something got lost in translation in porting the first wave of apps from that Garmin or Timex watch that you traditionally used, to the mobile device. Essential functionality such as "laps" were missed out on, while at the same time non-essential functionality such as "badges" or whatever added to the clutter. 
You may have switched from your watch to your mobile device to log your workouts. Then switched back, because you found your watch is still better. Or you haven't switched back, but you're left wishing the mobile captured the kind of training your watch captures. You don't know whether you're missing out on more, by using a watch or a mobile.
This is because the current crop of running apps are cluttered, and irrelevant to runner's needs.
Runners still use their watches over apps, and for a good reason. Because the watch tracks times relevant to the variety of training that you get from any good running program. Runners are still choosing to use their watches, for training such as "intervals", "hills", "tempo", "fartlek". This has to change, the world has gone mobile now.
FitFriend is bringing old reliable behaviour + new intuitive behaviour, to the mobile.
 
WHO We Are
Currently a 1-man shop, Mike Post is founder and CTO. Seeing as it's just me at the moment, I'm going to switch from the 3rd person now :) I come from 3 backgrounds - running, music & audio engineering, and computer engineering.
Running competitively as a teen in orienteering, and for my high school track & field team, training has been a part of my life in some way for almost 2 decades.
Playing music was also a big part of my life as a teen, and I studied the technology side of it at university for 3 years in my twenties. Not having enough of university, or technology, I returned 2 years later to study computer engineering. I've been working as a software engineer for almost 5 years now, mainly in mobile apps.
Sometimes you get a calling though, when you realise that something isn't as good as it could be - and that brings us to where we are now. Using my experience in running and engineering, to bring you kickass products. To me, quality matters most - that's going to be reflected in FitFriend products.
 
WHAT We Need
Your contributions, and your passion, to help drive this forward. Most of the engineering work has been completed for the initial release on iOS, and is currently entering beta testing. Choose 1 of the following perks to your right, from Spectator, Casual, Active, Competitor, or Olympian.
Funding will be directed to the incomplete work, for the initial iPhone release. in order of priority:
- Graphics
- Feature enhancements 
- iOS7 support
- Marketing / Advertising 
If the amount raised surpasses the goal of $5000, and reaches $10,000 the additional funding will be directed to future expansion:
- Pebble integration
- Coaching services
- Servers and iCloud integration
If the amount raised surpasses $20,000, the additional funding will be directed to the next line of future expansion:
- Blackberry10 release
- WP8 release
- Android release
 
LONGTERM
When things get crazy and we eventually have a large amount of funding available, there are some new types of hardware products in the pipeline, that will turn the way you do workouts upside down. 
 
PROMOTION
Can't offer funding? Or merely want to help out more? No problem - you can do that AND we can even give you something in return! 
All you need to do is to dress as a giant chicken and stand on a street corner, for 100 hours. Kidding! Instead, share the campaign using the share tools above. 
We'll give $200, to the person whose sharing, has led to the most amount of contributions. Ok? So anyone who logs into Indiegogo, and shares the campaign on Twitter, Facebook, or elsewhere, qualifies for this $200 prize! But only if you log into Indiegogo - otherwise we have no way of tracking you.
NOTE: I have to give credit to Tracy McMillan here for the same kind of promotion in Localeikki's excellent recreation database app :) If you're feeling extra generous, you can fund that here too.
 
Thank you for listening. We promise you that FitFriend will be a lot more exciting than this boring chunk of text you just read through. Stay tuned for more updates, by following us on Twitter or Facebook!

story:
The modern way of life often forces us to endure long hours in sitting positions. Unlike pre-school children who spend most of their time physically active, unfortunately, most of us are forced to sit: children in schools, adults at workplace, in the office or in the car.

Among all forms of resting, sitting has the worst impact on our health. The spine endures 75% more pressure when we sit than when we stand, and as much as seven times more pressure than when we are lying down!

The correct way of sitting requires constant and conscious adaptation of the body to an upright position, which is not easy in practice. Body subconsciously adjusts to the most enjoyable position, which is usually not good for our spine. Because our bended body, the lumbar part of the spine, is bulged wrongly, it produces increased pressure on the vertebrae.

EASEBelt relieves pain for people with occasional or chronic problems and/or with pains in the lumbar spine, allowing optimal support for the spine. For others, because of the product's design and structure, EASEBelt allows the preservation of the natural position of the spine, giving it a comfortable and reliable support. 

The product is primarily intended for the people who spent much of their time sitting down: working in the office, schools, kindergartens, or at home ... The EASEBelt can also benefit to the people in wheelchairs, working on tractors, excavators, cranes, etc.

With the regular use of EASEBelt and improving body posture while sitting, the risk of back problems is significantly reduced.

Let us not forget about regular exercise and constant movement. All accessories can help, but they are not a substitute for a healthy lifestyle.

Our body is an "engine" and does not need much to stay healthy. Let us listen to our body! Let us take care of it! 

Source: VentureBeat


EASEBelt is an elastic support band that we attach to the chair. The product is made to support and relieve our spine, legs and buttocks while we are sitting. 

Double pull straps enable its regulation, offering support even from the front, preventing our body to slide into a bulged position. Therefore, long periods of sitting down are not causing fatigue.

The EASEBelt is made from breathable materials, its elasticity provides a pleasant feeling of comfort and permits freedom of movement and blood circulation.


Negative force (our own body weight) is reduced with the positive force (which you regulate yourself to your own needs) provided by EASEBelt!

1. Simply put it on the back of a chair. Elastic fabrics allows you to install EASEBelt on the various shapes and forms of chairs.

2. Fasten yourself with the base ‘’hook and  loop” part of the belt.

3. With double pull elastic straps, EASEBelt can be easily strengthen or weaken. You simply adjusted it to your own need.

Clik here for EASEBelt 360° projection!


Hello everybody!

My name is Srečko and I would like to share a thought with you. While we live in a fast changing world of new technologies and their applications, we sometimes tend to forget about ourselves and our own comfort, while developing them.

I assume, most of you work in a sitting position as I do. In spite of my very comfortable chair I still get very tired at the end of the day and my body subconsciously forces me to sit or lie down even more.

So, I had to do something about it! To prevent this constant feeling of fatigue after the work day I created the EASEBelt. The EASEBelt provides a much needed support, which enables me to sit straight up and consequently feel relaxed, well rested and able to do anything even after a hard day at work! It was a surprise even to me how good I felt! My enthusiasm grew after I realized, that I got up easily and not feeling tired at all after long hours spent behind the desk. I have to admit it was a wonderful feeling.

And everyone who tried it claim the same!  

Finally, this is what I'm here for – I'm here to present the EASEBelt, the supportive and comfortable product.

The EASEBelt is very easy to use, convenient to wear, as well as adjustable to meet your needs and provide you the well-being you deserve.

I realized the positive change in my life very quickly, and my family noticed my energy as well. Especially my daughter, a recent graduate from the Faculty of Economics, who immediately saw the business opportunity. She suggested to develop the product further and involved some of her friends. The project has been taken over now by young and ambitious people that my daughter introduced to the EASEBelt, and I'm glad to see their progress.

So, you might noticed the various applications of EASEBelt and now it is up to you to experience how pleasant it is to work in the ''embrace of comfort''!

Srečko Pisnik (photo by Sami Rahim)


We came to a point where idea of EASEBelt has become a product suitable for use. After more than two years of testing and improvements, it is now time to be at users disposal.

Product design, basic models sewing, testing and preparation of the obligatory administration have been our own investment so far. We believe that all the effort and invested money can not compare with satisfaction and benefits EASEBelt offers to the users.

We need your help to improve the final product design and to begin with an optimal production volume.

The entire supply chain of the materials and manufacturing have to be planned carefully to ensure desired quality and consistency. We are only collaborating with people and businesses that we believe to be the best for this project. 

Be among the first to support this product and thereby receive one of the EASEBelt perk package. With your support we will make our idea a reality, and all of us will be able to work in "the embrace of comfort" after 1.3.2014!

We will greatly appreciate all of your support either by pledging or by getting the word about the project out there!

Thank you for being a part of our mission! 

EASEBelt team (from left: Dejan Pisnik, Srečko Pisnik, Jasmina Pisnik and Aljoša Antolin) (photo by Sami Rahim)


We will fly you and another person to our beautiful country Slovenia! 

EASEBelt team will take you to all the AMAZING places worth experiencing; 

this includes the oldest vine in the world (over 400 years), the mysterious caves, our   beautiful lakes, soulful cities, refreshing seaside, mouth watering national food and wine, etc.

You will receive a tailor made EASEBelts for you and your family.

We will find some time to talk about business as well as you get a chance of getting an exclusive franchise contract for a particular country. 


After your pledge an email will be send to you, so you can inform us of your preferences: If you want a Men's or Women's EASEBelt and what size would you like.

Perk 2

Please add $5 for shipping in the EU. 

Please add $10 for shipping outside the EU.

Perk 3

Please add $25 for shipping in the EU.

Please add $35 for shipping outside the EU.

Perk 4

Please add $45 for shipping in the EU.

Please add $55 for shipping outside the EU.


  • Our biggest challenge is to inform everyone that this is not yet another marketing hoax and that the product actually helps to improve the quality of life and makes sitting a comfortable experience.
  • Please keep in mind that the product is still a prototype. Design of the final product may be changed.
  • Note that EASEBelt is not an equivalent substitute for mandatory seat belt where it is required.
  • Patent pending.


Thanks to all who helped us create this project! 

Cameraman and editor: Jože Antolin - Foto Video Art, Showtec

Music in the video: "Julia" by Jahzzar - betterwithmusic.com

Dino Zorec - Dino DZ

Logo design: Uroš Škaper - www.skaper.si

Web page: Jakob Cvetko

Marino Plećaš

Sami Rahim

Marko Šerbinek 

Sandra Auer

Anže Kramberger - Gravo d.o.o.

David Klobasa, Darjan Klobasa - Agroremont d.o.o.

Mariborsko društvo za celebralno paralizo - Center Sonček

Strojegradnja Horvat, Anton Horvat s.p.

Ga. Edita Gošnik , Ga. Mojca Savaš - ERC - Evropsko razvojni center

Prevent moduli d.o.o.

Andra d.o.o.

Ga. Ana Milaković

G. Marjan Borovnik - Fulget d.o.o.

story:
Short Summary

Struggling with obesity is difficult. I know. I am a certified Fitness Instructor who struggled with it all through childhood and most of my adulthood... Until about six years ago when I was able to lose the weight, and even better, keep it off. I became passionate about helping others do the same. I bought Sweatshop Urban Gym & Fitness Studio six months ago so I could focus on doing just that. We offer group fitness classes, weight loss challenges and personal training geared towards weight loss and lifestyle changes. We have 15 classes each week and we just completed a ten week weight loss challenge where six participants lost over 95 lbs. We were so excited and ready to start another challenge and add more fitness classes, but we're struggling because the equipment is in poor condition. The gym has been around for some time and the equipment that came with it is old and starting to fall apart. I'm limited to the number of people I can have in a class because we don't have enough dumbbells, medicine balls or punching bags. I created this campaign, hoping to raise enough money for new punching bags for kickboxing (an awesome way to burn calories), as well as aerobic steps, new mats and flooring, medicine balls and other needed equipment so we can run weight loss challenges and clinics year round.

What We Need & What You Get

We’re hoping to raise $10,000, and since kickboxing is the best way to torch calories and is so much fun, we will spend most of that on new punching bags and the frames to hold them. We will also be able to get new matted floors for safety when kickboxing and doing other drills. With what’s left, we will purchase aerobic steps, medicine balls, resistance tubes and dumbbells.

We have several different contribution levels, starting as low as $10. With your contributions, you will receive photos of the new equipment, heartfelt thanks you’s and contributions above $50, you will receive personally designed workout programs to meet YOUR fitness goals, memberships to fitness classes, even one-on-one personal training.

The Impact

Our goal is simple… Help people of all ages live healthier, longer, fuller lives. Your contributions will help us do just that. I know investing money right now is hard. Times are tough and we all work hard for what we make. But your contribution will have a lasting impact on so many people. We’re experienced at helping others lose weight, keep it off, live healthy and feel better, and we want to continue our mission. Any contribution you can give will be so appreciated.


Other Ways You Can Help

Please share this campaign with everyone you know. Together, we can reach our goal, get new equipment, and fill this studio up with people eager for fitness and motivated to live a healthy lifestyle.

story:
The quick 411:

1) Your money will go toward printing high quality, high gloss 12x12 calendars, for the packaging and shipping of those calendars, for swag (buttons, stickers, cards, etc.) and a portion of the proceeds will go to Basic Rights Oregon.

2) We are a non-profit organization. Absolutely no one in this project has been compensated monetarily or in any other way for their time, effort and expertise in working on this project. This project is truly a labor of love.

3) Even if we don't meet our goal, we still get the funds for this project and can print small batches of calendars. If you order a calendar, you will get one.


Help us fund the printing of our plus-size pin-up calendar!

The make-up is done, the hairspray cans are empty and the photos are gorgeous, but now we need your help. Next comes the hard part, taking these amazing photos and making them into a beautiful calendar.

Body acceptance is a radical concept. Accepting your body, exactly the way it is right now. We love our bodies, just the way they are, and we want to share this amazing experience with you.

That is what Pudge PDX is all about. We are a group of diverse individuals who strive to promote this unheard of idea of loving yourself completely.




What We Need & What You Get

Over the past seven months we have been brainstorming, organizing, creating, crafting, drawing, and imagining. We've had nine photoshoots and over 80 volunteers working to make this project a reality. We have the drive, the organization and the passion to make this calendar. We are in the final stretch and now we are confronting the costs of the printing, promotion, distribution and shipping of the calendar. This is where *YOU* come in!


    Our preliminary research has shown us that in order to have 100 to 200 calendars printed, in the glossy professional style we want to present, the printing alone will cost at least $7000. That plus shipping and handling costs and materials to cover perks have made us decide on the $10,000 mark for the project to be completed.


    The Impact

    This is our first project, but you can help make it the first of many. We believe that body acceptance is something that should be shared with every person, and it begins with changing the visual narrative of only seeing white, thin and conventionally pretty models. We want to show you rolls, thick thighs and wobbling bellies. Our bodies; your bodies. They are gorgeous and they deserve some time in the limelight!

    Pudge started here at home in Portland, OR, but it's reach could go far and wide! The best thing about body acceptance is that it's for everyBODY!



    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that not everyone can contribute a monetary amount, however there are still ways you can help! If you live in the Portland, OR area and want to volunteer your time or if you live far, far away and want to learn about starting your own body positive community where you live please contact us at pudgepdx@gmail.com.

    You can also help us out by following us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and Tumblr!

    Never underestimate the power of word-of-mouth! Please tell everyone you know about Pudge PDX and this project! Use the Indiegogo tools to share this crowdfund on your own social media and help us spread the word!

    Thank you!

We are in the final stretch and now we are confronting the costs of the printing, promotion, distribution and shipping of the calendar. This is where *YOU* come in! 
  



Our preliminary research has shown us that in order to have 100 to 200 calendars printed, in the glossy professional style we want to present, the printing alone will cost at least $7000. That plus shipping and handling costs and materials to cover perks have made us decide on the $10,000 mark for the project to be completed.

The Impact This is our first project, but you can help make it the first of many. 
We believe that body acceptance is something that should be shared with 
every person, and it begins with changing the visual narrative of only 
seeing white, thin and conventionally pretty models. We want to show 
you rolls, thick thighs and wobbling bellies. Our bodies; your 
bodies. They are gorgeous and they deserve some time in the limelight! 
Pudge started here at home in Portland, OR, but it's reach could go far 
and wide! The best thing about body acceptance is that it's for 
everyBODY!
  




Other Ways You Can Help 
We understand that not everyone can contribute a monetary amount, 
however there are still ways you can help! If you live in the Portland, OR 
area and want to volunteer your time or if you live far, far away and 
want to learn about starting your own body positive community where you 
live please contact us at pudgepdx@gmail.com.You can also help us 
out by following us on Facebook, Instagram, Twitter and Tumblr!Never underestimate the power of word-of-mouth! Please tell everyone you know about Pudge PDX and this project! Use the Indiegogo tools to share this crowdfund on your own social media and help us spread the word! Thank you!

story:
To know Rachelle Briton (McDonald) Miller is to know how much of a wonderful, passionate, giving, caring, and loving person she is. She has always been an extremely motivated woman, a trailblazer, who doesn't take life for granted, and loves God.

Unfortunately, Rachelle was diagnosed with Chronic Sclerosing Osteomyelitis (a rare bone infection) in her right jaw in 2011. Her journey has been different than most patients because she also has autoimmune issues (Sjogren's syndrome, and Lupus). As a result of these diseases, her body has a difficult time handling certain medications like antibiotics and steroids, and has resulted in multiple emergency room visits and two cases of C-Diff.

Since she was diagnosed with CSO, she's had two surgeries at home in Austin, Texas, (2012-2013). As those surgeries did not prove to be a success, she had two more extensive jaw surgeries at the Mayo Clinic in Rochester, Minnesota (2013). Finally, as the disease was still present and continued to worsen, she had two more  surgeries in Miami, Florida (2013-2014). Her last surgery in Miami resulted in the doctor (Dr. Marx) removing a significant part of her right jaw bone and replacing it with a titanium chain. As a result of the surgery, the doctor had to cut the nerve in the jaw, which has rendered Rachelle numb on the lower right side of her face permanently (an x-ray of her jawbone is below).

In order to stay afloat financially, she has been trying to win her disability case with the state. She has been relentlessly fighting this battle because everyone she has encountered with the exact same condition has been able to win.

Before the disease, Rachelle built and launched her own fashion design company "Rachelle Briton Designs" in August of 2009, and immediately began reaching out to help her community. From charity fashion shows, garment donations, to mentoring high school students looking for a future in the arts, & counseling fashion design interns in college's nearby. Rachelle's main focus has always been about helping others, through her talents.

In 2012, she decided to put her fashion design business on hold. Although she has been unable to design over the past few years, she has been be a positive influence for others dealing with similar diseases. http://rachellebriton.blogspot.com. 

More about Rachelle...

As Rachelle continues this fight this rare and awful bone disease, she is scheduled to undergo a bone graft to place over the titanium chain on September 25, 2014, in Miami, Florida. Following surgery, her jaw will be wired shut for 3-6 weeks to ensure the bone sets and begins to mold together properly. She is expected to recover in 2-5 months. 

Following her bone graft recovery, Rachelle will begin the process of receiving dental implants for roughly 7 teeth on her lower right jaw.

What We Need...

Rachelle and her family are trying to raise money to not only help with the travel, lodging, food, and surgery expenses for next surgery in Miami, but to help pay off some of the staggering medical/travel expenses from previous surgeries over the past 2 1/2 years.

The money raised will be used for medical and other expenses not covered by insurance. A breakdown on how these funds will be used:

• Medical & Dental Bills (Past, Present, & Future) 

• Co-Payments (multiple doctors: maxillofacial surgeon in Miami, maxillofacial    doctors in Austin, pain management doctor, family doctor, dentist, rheumatologist)

• Travel Costs (airplane tickets, hotels, food, gas, rental car, etc...)

• Supplements, Prescriptions, Therapy

•  Hospital Stays, Surgeries

• Transportation and gas 

The Impact

As mentioned above, Rachelle is fighting an extremely rare and painful bone infection and we need all the help we can get. We've seen a dozen doctors in Austin and at the Mayo, and finally found a doctor in Miami who correctly diagnosed and treated the condition.

The doctor who diagnosed this condition stated that more and more people have been affected by this issue but have gone undiagnosed. Rachelle hopes to develop a support system for people dealing with chronic pain and to educate the general public and medical professionals about this condition.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that everyone cannot financially assist us and we certainly understand. Please share this page with your friends and family so we can try to meet our goal.

You may be able to help by bringing meals to our house during her recovery and/or spending time with her once we're back in Austin. Additionally, as Rachelle's jaw will be wired shut for a substantial period of time, she will not be able to eat regular meals, and will require a specialized diet. As such, gift cards for groceries and/or other services are welcome as well.

Also, your thoughts, prayers, and words of encouragement for Rachelle are needed just as much as the funds!

Thanks and God Bless.

Please visit Rachelle's blog for more updates on her journey! http://rachellebriton.blogspot.com

***Although we cannot afford to offer perks at this time, we do plan on offering something special to everyone who donates following her surgery***

story:
Bref résumé

Le soccer est en pleine expansion au Canada et plus particulièrement au Québec depuis 30 ans. Il y a de plus en plus de joueurs et de joueuses.

La culture du haut-niveau est présente dans les sports tels que hockey sur glace et le football américain. Au soccer la demande est là mais l’offre ne permet pas de combler cette attente.

Notre objectif est de former des joueurs et joueuses diplômé(e)s, capables de jouer au niveau professionnel.

Nos besoins

La construction de notre centre d'entrainement nécessite une mise de fond importante (200 000$).

Nous sollicitons la communauté afin d'obtenir 20 000$ qui nous permettrait de finaliser notre recherche de financement et d'emprunter 800 000$.

    L'impact

    Notre cheminement permet aux jeunes d'obtenir une bourse d’études universitaires canadienne, américaine ou, pour les meilleurs, la possibilité d’intégrer un centre de formation d’un club professionnel européens.

    Le centre d'entrainement est indispensable car il va permettre de :

    • Offrir le meilleur accueil possible aux joueurs et joueuses et leur permettre d'atteindre leur meilleur niveau en soccer
    • Crédibiliser notre action auprès des parents et partenaires potentiels

    En investissant dans notre projet vous vous montrez sensible à leur envie de réussir dans la vie!

      Défis

      Réunir la mise de fond (200 000$) représente un gros défis car sans elle nous ne pourrons pas réaliser les objectifs de carrière de nos joueurs et joueuses.

      Le financement solidaire est la dernière étape de notre campagne de financement.

      Comment nous aider d'avantage?

      N'hésitez pas à parler du projet et à partager cette initiative auprès des personnes que vous connaissez
