story:
What is uRADMonitor?

uRADMonitor is a project that addresses pollution, the kind that we are unable to see, but directly affects our health and can cause life threatening diseases. To help fight pollution, we have designed several fixed and mobile detectors, packed with powerful sensors, capable of detecting both the chemical and the physical harmful factors. All data goes online to a global network, so anyone can access it freely, at any time.



What type of pollutants are uRADMonitor devices able to detect?

uRADMonitor devices are able to detected a wide variety of pollutants, like: alpha, beta, gamma and x-ray radiation, an extended range of volatile organic compounds, the dangerous - potentially lethal gasses like Carbon Monoxide, Carbon Dioxide, particulate matter suspended in air, many of which are hazardous, like: dust, pollen, soot, smoke, or any liquid droplets, as well as barometric pressure, temperature and humidity.

By acquiring a device, you will not only benefit personally from its readings, securing your health, but you will also contribute to building the global pollution map, increasing people’s awareness on this issue.



 

uRADMonitor models description

We took several hardware designs from prototyping to production in record time. Choose the variant that suits you best, all are excellent detectors.

 

uRADMonitor Model D


The first portable unit in the series, this model opens a new direction with additional sensors focused on air quality and pollution.

It can measure temperature, barometric pressure, humidity, dust concentration, pollen, smoke, soot, VOC (volatile organic compounds) and also alpha, beta, gamma and x-ray radiation.

It has a large color LCD with a touchscreen and can connect to WiFi networks to  gain Internet access and synchronize all measurements with the central server. 

The internal alarm is used for audible warnings for elevated readings, dangerous for our health. These notifications can also be transmitted automatically via email or sms.


Model D is equipped with the following sensors and features:
•LND712 made in the USA for Alpha, Beta and Gamma Radiation
•BME680 from Bosch, to measure air temperature, barometric pressure, humidity and VOC with great stability
•Sharp photoelectric sensor to measure dust, pollen, soot, smoke and other particulate matter
•1500mAh rechargeable battery for 8 hours of continuous use
•wireless 802.11b/g/n connectivity
•mini USB connector for charging or data

The retail price of URADMonitor model D is 590 USD + shipping

Early bird for URADMonitor model D comes with a special price of  490 USD + shipping


uRADMonitor Model A

Designed with an aluminium enclosure, with a rubber gasket for rain protection, this model has an internal temperature sensor and a Geiger Tube to detect Gamma radiation. Measurements are transmitted automatically, via the  Internet, using a cable Ethernet connection.


Model A uses the SBM-20 Military Geiger Tube sensor for Radiation, an internal temperature sensor and Ethernet connectivity with plug and play DHCP support.

The retail price of URADMonitor model A is 190 USD + shipping

Early bird for URADMonitor model A comes with a special price of  150 USD + shipping

 

uRADMonitor KIT1

This variant is released as Open Source, with complete specs publicly available. To build one you only need a soldering iron. Once complete, it measures the Gamma radiation and using the integrated Ethernet connectivity, will send all measurements automatically via the Internet, to the central server. It can also be used as a portable dosimeter, showing all measurements on the LCD.


KIT1 uses the SBM-20 Military Geiger Tube sensor for Radiation and Ethernet connectivity with plug and play DHCP support.

The retail price of URADMonitor KIT1 solderable is 90 USD + shipping

The retail price of URADMonitor KIT1 assembled is  120 USD + shipping


How are the readings visualised?

uRADMonitor is the first global surveillance monitoring network created to track pollution. Readings can be viewed instantly on the models that have a display: model D and KIT1. Measurements are centralised automatically, and online data allows us to build graphs, stats and send automated notifications when certain thresholds are reached.   The web portal can be accessed on www.uradmonitor.com  by anyone, at anytime, for free. The project started back in 2013 and the number of worldwide users has already reached 300.  This infrastructure is an amazing piece of technology, handling big data loads in real time.  With a click, you see the entire world mapped in colours, hopefully as green as possible!




What makes uRADMonitor unique?

uRADMonitor is the first global network created to track pollution, in order to increase awareness and secure health. It already reached 300 users with Model A for over a year, proving its quality and reliability.


uRADMonitor Model D advantages:

• it is the first to use the newest and most reliable VOC sensor, that will only be available from next year. Similar handheld devices, using VOC sensors, available on the market, have very little life span and poor stability. This is probably the reason why no pollution large scale maps were available up to now.


• it has a larger number of sensors compared with most pollution detectors on the market, therefore it's more sensitive and able to measure multiple parameters affecting the air quality.


• it has the best price on the market considering the many sensors and its incredible features.

• an easy to use UI


• it is a complex gadget, equipped with a wide range of high quality expensive sensors, a colour display, wireless module and a rechargeable battery, making it an independent device (with no additional software required nor any smartphones to do its job). This is a professional device, with an expensive production chain but that's what you get so don't settle for anything less. We're also trying to fit any budget, this is why the project allows joining with a multitude of detectors. Our next goal is to build 2 simpler, smaller, lightweight and affordable  but still high quality, VOC and radiation detector models, in the near future, addressing them primarily to bicyclists and joggers and all people interested and supporting a cleaner environment. We're making it happen!



The uRADMonitor devices come with some amazing features:


Frequently asked questions

How do uRADMonior devices work?

uRADMonior devices are packed with powerful sensors, capable of detecting both the chemical and the physical harmful factors, that can impact our lifespan and cause life threatening diseases. Readings can be viewed instantly on the devices that have a display. All readings are centralised automatically on www.uradmonitor.com. Online data allows us to build graphs, stats and send automated notifications when certain thresholds are reached.

Who can benefit from these devices? Why should I get one?

Anyone, with or without a device can benefit from this project. The www.uradmonitor.com is available for free, offering valuable uncensored pollution statistics and graphs, around the world. If you want to get specific information on your own location you can purchase a device and by doing so you get to contribute to the entire network as well.

Every day synthetic, toxic chemicals are released into the environment. The air is what we breathe; what travels through the air is what we inhale. As it ultimately affects the future of our planet and us, it is considered to be a global threat at huge cost to the environment.

People with allergies, asthma, lung cancer or other respiratory diseases can benefit the most from these devices, as their health state might not give them the option to ignore excessive dust, pollen, high concentration of toxic chemicals or highly polluted traffic areas. Knowing the facts might be a life saver for people that are already ill and a good preventer for us all.


What is radiation?

Radiation may be defined as energy traveling through space. Non-ionizing radiation, like:microwaves, lasers, radio waves, infrared light, radar or ultraviolet light is essential to life, but excessive exposures will cause tissue damage, whereas all forms of ionizing radiation, like: the cosmic radiation that passes the atmosphere, x-ray used for screenings or the decay of radioactive isotopes especially found near uranium mines and nuclear plants, can cause damage to living tissue, and can result in mutation, radiation sickness, cancer, and death.

Radiation sources are found in a wide range of occupational settings like: airline crew (the most exposed population), industrial radiography, medical radiology and nuclear medicine, uranium mining , nuclear power plant, research laboratories. Massive particles are a concern for astronauts outside the earth's magnetic field who would receive solar particles from solar proton events (SPE) and galactic cosmic rays from cosmic sources.

The public also is exposed to radiation from consumer products, such as tobacco (polonium-210), combustible fuels (gas, coal, etc.), televisions, luminous watches and dials (tritium), airport X-ray systems, smoke detectors (americium), electron tubes, and gas lantern mantles (thorium). Air travel exposes people on aircraft to increased radiation from space up to 40 times more compared to the ground level.


How can radiation affect my health?

If radiation is not properly controlled it can be potentially hazardous to the health. Ionizing radiation — the kind that minerals, atom bombs and nuclear reactors emit — does one main thing to the human body: it weakens and breaks up DNA, either damaging cells enough to kill them or causing them to mutate in ways that may eventually lead to cancer.


What are VOCs?

Volatile organic compounds, sometimes referred to as VOCs, are chemicals that easily become vapours or gases, that contain carbon and are found in all living things. Along with carbon, they contain elements such as hydrogen, oxygen, fluorine, chlorine, bromine, sulfur or nitrogen.

Volatile organic compounds are released from burning fuel, such as gasoline, wood, coal, or natural gas. They are also emitted from oil and gas fields and diesel exhaust. Other sources include: solvents, paints, glues, and other products some of which can be used or stored at home and at work.

Many volatile organic compounds are also hazardous air pollutants. Volatile organic compounds, when combined with nitrogen oxides, react to form ground-level ozone, or smog, which can contribute to climate change.

Examples of volatile organic compounds are gasoline, benzene, formaldehyde, solvents such as toluene and xylene, styrene, and perchloroethylene, the main solvent used in dry cleaning.

Many volatile organic compounds are commonly used in paint thinners, lacquer thinners, moth repellents, air fresheners, hobby supplies, wood preservatives, aerosol sprays, degreasers, automotive products, and dry cleaning fluids.


How might I be exposed to volatile organic compounds?

Volatile organic compounds are common air pollutants found in most of the air. You can be exposed to volatile organic compounds outdoors by breathing polluted air that contains them. You are most likely to be exposed to volatile organic compounds outdoors in the summer, when the sun and hot temperatures react with pollution or during the foggy winter days,to form smog, causing various respiratory health diseases.

Indoors, products that contain volatile organic compounds release emissions when you use them, and to a smaller degree, when they are stored. You can be exposed to volatile organic compounds at home when you are cooking like grilling and frying or when you use cleaning, painting, or hobby supplies products that contain VOCs. You can also be exposed if you dry clean your clothes with home dry-cleaning products; if you dry-clean your clothes at a professional dry-cleaner; or if you use graphics and crafts materials such as glues, permanent markers, and photographic solutions.

At work, you can be exposed to volatile organic compounds if involved with dry cleaning, in a photography studio, or an office that uses copiers, printers, or correction fluids. You can also be exposed if you work in chemical manufacturing or with petroleum-based products.

How can volatile organic compounds affect my health?

The health effects of volatile organic compounds can vary greatly according to the compound, which can range from being highly toxic to having no known health effects. The health effects of volatile organic compounds will depend on the nature of the volatile organic compound, the level of exposure, and the length of exposure.

According to the Thirteenth Report on Carcinogens published by the National Toxicology Program, benzene and formaldehyde are human carcinogens; perchloroethylene and styrene are "reasonably anticipated to be human carcinogens." People at the highest risk of long-term exposure to these three volatile organic compounds are industrial workers who have prolonged exposure to the compounds used at the workplace; cigarette smokers; and people who have prolonged exposure to emissions from heavy motor vehicle traffic.

Long-term exposure to volatile organic compounds can cause damage to the liver, kidneys, and central nervous system. Short-term exposure to volatile organic compounds can cause eye and respiratory tract irritation, headaches, dizziness, visual disorders, fatigue, loss of coordination, allergic skin reactions, nausea, and memory impairment.

How does dust affect my health?

Very small particles can be deeply respired into the lungs and remain there. These type of particles, small enough to be inhaled may cause: irritation of the eyes, coughing, sneezing, hayfever or asthma attacks.

Other dust-related, human-health concerns include airborne transmission of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, and fungus) and the compositions of certain hazardous dust particles.

Some minerals in dust are extremely hazardous, such as certain asbestiform minerals or silica because of their ability to lodge in lung tissue and promote disease such as lung cancer. Other minerals may contain potentially toxic elements, such as certain heavy metals.

Does the device detect pollen?

uRADMonitor Model D, does not have a specific pollen detector, but pollen particles would be detected just like other particulate matter.

How does CO affect my health?

Carbon monoxide, or CO, is a toxic gas that you cannot see or smell. CO is given off whenever fuel or other carbon-based materials are burned with insufficient air. Breathing CO can cause headache, dizziness, vomiting, and nausea. If CO levels are high enough, you may become unconscious or die. Exposure to moderate and high levels of CO over long periods of time has also been linked with increased risk of heart disease. People who survive severe CO poisoning may suffer long-term health problems.

Scientists are not sure what the health effects are when a person is exposed to low levels of CO over a long period of time. Better tracking of CO poisoning and exposure can help us learn about the effects of long-term exposures to low levels of CO.


How does knowing all the pollutants I’m being exposed to, get to help me?

"Like in many other mornings, my wife was preparing the breakfast, she was making toast for the breakfast. I’ve made some tests with uRADMonitor Model D an evening before, and the device was still running in the kitchen. I instantly received a notification on my phone with VOCs being on dangerous levels. At first I thought it could not be all of the sudden and it must be a false alarm, since the device was in its beta testing days, but then I realised it was actually the toast producing all the harmful gasses. We stopped this harmful habit right away!

One morning we took a ride through the city to test the air quality with the newly mounted experimental setup. We gathered data from almost 2 hours of driving, even passing a few times through the same place. As you can see in the video, data was automatically sent and displayed on the mobile, although without a map it was hard to appreciate the readings on site. Once we arrived home I’ve mapped all readings and I was surprised so see that on one of the streets the radiation levels were gradually increasing as we approached a location and then they were gradually decreasing as we were driving away from that place, meaning there was some kind of radioactive source in there. It might have been the basalt or granite used for construction which can contain uranium or some kind of radioactive waste and I'm tempted to dig more on this problem.

In some of the days, especially when the temperatures dropped we were more tempted to skip house ventilation too often so VOCs levels, especially from cooking and use of certain housekeeping products were increasing high enough to receive an alert on phone. This worked as a great reminder to ventilate our home!"  said Radu Motisan

These are just a few of the situations we’ve faced since testing uRADMonitor, but normally we might have never guessed what's there. So the answer is definitely, YES! There are actions we can take in certain situations, to minimise air pollution around us, instantly.


Did you know?

Indoor air quality can be up to 10 times worse than outdoor?

Some of the most dangerous VOCs are CO, formaldehyde and benzene and the last two are found in diesel emissions?

Sooty, smelly diesel exhaust is more than just unpleasant -- it's a mix of more than 40 toxic air contaminants and has been linked to cancer, asthma and more than 21,000 premature deaths across USA every year. Many Americans live and work near diesel hotspots such as truck depots, bus terminals, ports, construction sites and busy roads and highways. Some studies have shown that kids riding inside diesel school buses can be exposed to higher levels of unhealthy diesel soot than people riding in nearby cars.

Formaldehyde is a cancer-causing chemical used for a number of purposes, including the manufacture of insulation, pesticides and disinfectants. But most industrial emissions of formaldehyde -- 42 percent -- are from the lumber industry, which uses adhesives containing formaldehyde to make plywood. Formaldehyde has been linked to lung cancer, and may also cause leukemia and asthma attacks. Diesel emissions also contribute to formaldehyde pollution.

To minimize formaldehyde exposures at home, make sure any wood furniture or fixtures that use particleboard are laminated or otherwise coated, choose exterior- rather than interior-grade pressed wood products for remodelling and be sure that areas where you are using products containing formaldehyde are well ventilated.

Used in motor fuels, solvents, detergents, pesticides and many other substances, benzene is a carcinogen that causes leukemia as well as a number of other illnesses. Virtually the entire U.S. population is exposed to benzene in at least small amounts -- at gas stations (it's in the gasoline), in diesel exhaust or from cigarette smoke, including second-hand smoke. Benzene also a problem in a number of workplaces, including oil refineries, coal-coking operations at steel mills, chemical processing plants, rubber manufacturing plants and laboratories, where it is often used as a solvent for other chemicals. You can avoid one significant source of benzene by stepping away from the gas pump when refuelling your car.

When you inhale microscopic bits of particulate matter -- otherwise known as soot -- fine particles can become embedded in your lungs and impair their function?

As many as 64,000 premature deaths occur each year from cardiopulmonary causes attributable to particulate air pollution. Most particulate emissions result from burning fossil fuels -- coal, oil, diesel, gasoline -- or wood. Old coal-fired power plants, industrial boilers, diesel and gas-powered vehicles and wood stoves are some of the worst culprits. High-temperature industrial processes such as metal smelting and steel production are also significant sources.

Everyone can help cut down on particulate matter pollution by conserving energy and choosing cleaner, more efficient energy sources for home heating and cooling, transportation, and appliances. Certainly, limiting your use of wood-burning fireplaces and stoves is a good start.

Exposure to radon is estimated to be the second leading cause of lung cancer?

It accounts for an estimated 21,000 lung cancer deaths each year (range of 8,000 to 45,000). Radon is a tasteless, colourless and odorless gas that is produced by decaying uranium and occurs naturally in soil and rock. The majority of these deaths occur among smokers since there is a greater risk for lung cancer when smokers also are exposed to radon.


The making of






A global success in one year

Packed with powerful sensors, capable of detecting both the chemical and the physical harmful factors, uRADMonitor is an example of a complex piece of technology driven by motivation to help people solve the pollution problem. And it's not just about your neighborhood or city, it goes way up to global scale.

The project is the result of considerable research on electronics, sensor physics and software, spreading on more than two years. uRADMonitor has received international recognition, taking the grand prize on Arad Innovation Fair and being a finalist in two categories on the prestigious Hackaday Prize competition.

 


uRADMonitor media coverage

The video below is in Romanian. Please use the CC button for English subtitles.


Moments from Hackaday SuperConference in San Francisco:



uRADMonitor featured in Atmel interview: http://blog.atmel.com/2015/11/06/11-interview-with-hackaday-prize-finalist-radu-motisan/


uRADMonitor project page on Hackaday.io, finalist in Hackaday Prize: https://hackaday.io/project/4977-portable-environmental-monitor City air quality experiment first page coverage: http://hackaday.com/2015/11/07/air-quality-surveillance-for-whole-cities/

uRADMonitor D uses the BME680 sensor from Bosch. Bosch Sensortec will feature an interview with this project soon!

Why crowdfunding?

uRADMonitor is a project that started from passion and personal need of its creator of acquiring uncensored, real time pollution information. Radu Motisan updated his progress on his personal blog: www.pocketmagic.net with his weekly entries . Many of his visitors became interested in this project contributing with ideas. Soon what started as a hobby transformed into a product that further developed as a community project. This is why uRADMonitor needs your support! We believe that by bringing uRADMonitor project to a higher scale, we can accomplish our goal of increasing awareness on pollution dangers, consequently helping us all fight against its factors. By contributing to this project you will get involved in this great mission along with other people that believe in our work and share our vision.


Frequently asked questions


Where  are the devices shipped from?
uRADMonitor is made by a company registered in the EU. But, to reduce costs, production is made in China. Therefore all devices will be shipped from China.  The customers have the responsibility of paying any customs charges, including VAT. 

Do I need a mobile or do I have to download a software, for these devices to work?

No. All models have been designed to work as standalone devices. No mobile or other software required.

Will I receive notifications/allerts when threshold are reached?

Yes, you will get immediate specific notifications.

Do they work indoor and outdoor?

uRADMonitor Model D is a portable device, you can take it with you wherever you are.

Although Model A is a fixed dosimeter and does not have a display, you can take it with you anywhere you have internet access, all readings will be visible on www.uradmonitor.com

KIT1 can be used both as a fixed monitoring station or a mobile unit.

How do the devices communicate with the server?

Model D has a built in wifi module to connect to the internet wirelessly. Model A and Model KIT1 use an ethernet connection by cable to your internet router. Everything is plug and play. The devices simply get an IP via DHCP and they are ready to talk to the server.

How long does the battery last?

uRADMonitor D currently has a high capacity 1500mAh lithium battery which can support normal system functions for as long as 12 hours of use.


Are the devices waterproof?

Although we’ve designed the models so that all sensors are minimally exposed to elements, these devices are measuring the air quality, so a good air flow is necessary. You should avoid water getting into your Model D unit! Model A is a fixed dosimeter that can be mounted outside as it's rainproofed when installed vertically with cables down. KIT1 depends on your own enclosing solution.

What is the operating temperature?

Model A has been successfully tested to function properly in a -25° C +65° C.

Who can see the readings from my device?

All data is open source, so the idea is to share all readings on the portal unless you opt-out. Additionally you can configure the location displayed on the map for a better accuracy or a better privacy.


About the author

Radu Motisan is the architect and the creator of this project. 

 "By training I'm a software engineer. By hobby I'm a chemist, physicist and electronics amateur. By heart I am the man that will use the best of his skills to build technology that matters - that has an impact on other people's lives. Luckily this background allowed venturing into the corners of hardware design and production, with ease." says Radu Motisan who also runs a well known technology blog on www.pocketmagic.net to share some of his achievements in technical fields.

To learn more about uRADMonitor's founder, you can read Radu's interview with Atmel and soon to be published the interview with Bosch.



Distribution and Costumer support

Where do you ship to?

uRADMonitors can be shipped worldwide.

How much is the shipping cost?

Shipping cost is 10$. For express shipping, you’ll have to get a 15$ extra perk.

When will you ship?

We will do our best to ship de devices according to the plan.

Warranty?

All issues related to design flaws, product defects will be handled at no additional cost to the customer other than shipping the unit back for repairs or replacement, for a full year after the product has been delivered.

How will the raised money be used?

The funds will primarily be used for manufacturing the devices, but also to spawn new, innovative technologies to make our lives better.

How do I get in contact with you? Do you have a customer support?

All questions and messages can be directed to 


Risks and challenges

We already have the hardware production ready for the three models but it is always possible to encounter delays when dealing with a new gadget production, especially one that is so complex, having a hardware and the software component involved. And then, the project can be delayed by situations that do not depend on us, like the manufacturing of the components from different suppliers. Bosch’s VOC sensors that are used in uRADMonitor Model Ds, are advertised to be available in 2016 Q1, yet there isn’t an exact timeframe.

Whatever the situation we promise to communicate you the status.

The model A and the KIT1 are mature, and have passed the test of time in terms of reliability. Production plan for these two is complete, and we can start delivery soon.



Model D is new, and there is ongoing development on the software side, but that follows a predictable pattern.  The only difficult challenge remains in making the project known, and spreading the network for increased resolution. And here you can help! Either by supporting this project and getting a detector, either by sharing it among your friends. Both count equally and we are greatful. Our struggle doesn't end here: we're constantly involved in active research on better sensors and more hardware units. We've built a platform, and adding more sensors is the natural way to go, to include water quality.

A considerable amount of money will be spent on getting all required certifications and unit metrology tests in speciliased laboratories. The future plans also include wearables, adding pollution trackers to devices increasingly smaller. With your help, we will get there! 


 

Get a unit, and join the network!

We've come a long way getting the project were it is today. It works and it does a great job, but we need your help to speed up the development and increase the coverage. 

It's very simple. Get a unit, and join the network. You get a dosimeter to monitor the quality of your environment 24/7, but you also support the work, and research, invested in this community project, helping it move forward.

The impact is huge. With each new unit, the project makes a step forward in its mission of delivering uncensored environmental readings worldwide!


Thank you!
story_txt:
What is uRADMonitor?uRADMonitor is a project that addresses pollution, the kind that we are unable to see, but directly affects our health and can cause life threatening diseases. To help fight pollution, we have designed several fixed and mobile detectors, packed with powerful sensors, capable of detecting both the chemical and the physical harmful factors. All data goes online to a global network, so anyone can access it freely, at any time.


What type of pollutants are uRADMonitor devices able to detect?
uRADMonitor devices are able to detected a wide variety of pollutants, like: alpha, beta, gamma and x-ray radiation, an extended range of volatile organic compounds, the dangerous - potentially lethal gasses like Carbon Monoxide, Carbon Dioxide, particulate matter suspended in air, many of which are hazardous, like: dust, pollen, soot, smoke, or any liquid droplets, as well as barometric pressure, temperature and humidity.
By acquiring a device, you will not only benefit personally from its readings, securing your health, but you will also contribute to building the global pollution map, increasing people’s awareness on this issue.


 
uRADMonitor models description
We took several hardware designs from prototyping to production in record time. Choose the variant that suits you best, all are excellent detectors.
 
uRADMonitor Model D


The first portable unit in the series, this model opens a new direction with additional sensors focused on air quality and pollution.
It can measure temperature, barometric pressure, humidity, dust concentration, pollen, smoke, soot, VOC (volatile organic compounds) and also alpha, beta, gamma and x-ray radiation.
It has a large color LCD with a touchscreen and can connect to WiFi networks to  gain Internet access and synchronize all measurements with the central server. 
The internal alarm is used for audible warnings for elevated readings, dangerous for our health. These notifications can also be transmitted automatically via email or sms.
Model D is equipped with the following sensors and features:
 •LND712 made in the USA for Alpha, Beta and Gamma Radiation
 •BME680 from Bosch, to measure air temperature, barometric pressure, humidity and VOC with great stability
 •Sharp photoelectric sensor to measure dust, pollen, soot, smoke and other particulate matter
 •1500mAh rechargeable battery for 8 hours of continuous use
 •wireless 802.11b/g/n connectivity
 •mini USB connector for charging or dataThe retail price of URADMonitor model D is 590 USD + shippingEarly bird for URADMonitor model D comes with a special price of  490 USD + shipping

uRADMonitor Model A

Designed with an aluminium enclosure, with a rubber gasket for rain protection, this model has an internal temperature sensor and a Geiger Tube to detect Gamma radiation. Measurements are transmitted automatically, via the  Internet, using a cable Ethernet connection.

Model A uses the SBM-20 Military Geiger Tube sensor for Radiation, an internal temperature sensor and Ethernet connectivity with plug and play DHCP support.
The retail price of URADMonitor model A is 190 USD + shippingEarly bird for URADMonitor model A comes with a special price of  150 USD + shipping 

uRADMonitor KIT1


This variant is released as Open Source, with complete specs publicly available. To build one you only need a soldering iron. Once complete, it measures the Gamma radiation and using the integrated Ethernet connectivity, will send all measurements automatically via the Internet, to the central server. It can also be used as a portable dosimeter, showing all measurements on the LCD.
KIT1 uses the SBM-20 Military Geiger Tube sensor for Radiation and Ethernet connectivity with plug and play DHCP support.The retail price of URADMonitor KIT1 solderable is 90 USD + shippingThe retail price of URADMonitor KIT1 assembled is  120 USD + shipping
How are the readings visualised?
uRADMonitor is the first global surveillance monitoring network created to track pollution. Readings can be viewed instantly on the models that have a display: model D and KIT1. Measurements are centralised automatically, and online data allows us to build graphs, stats and send automated notifications when certain thresholds are reached.   The web portal can be accessed on www.uradmonitor.com  by anyone, at anytime, for free. The project started back in 2013 and the number of worldwide users has already reached 300.  This infrastructure is an amazing piece of technology, handling big data loads in real time.  With a click, you see the entire world mapped in colours, hopefully as green as possible!






What makes uRADMonitor unique?
uRADMonitor is the first global network created to track pollution, in order to increase awareness and secure health. It already reached 300 users with Model A for over a year, proving its quality and reliability.uRADMonitor Model D advantages:• it is the first to use the newest and most reliable VOC sensor, that will only be available from next year. Similar handheld devices, using VOC sensors, available on the market, have very little life span and poor stability. This is probably the reason why no pollution large scale maps were available up to now.
 • it has a larger number of sensors compared with most pollution detectors on the market, therefore it's more sensitive and able to measure multiple parameters affecting the air quality. 
 • it has the best price on the market considering the many sensors and its incredible features.• an easy to use UI
 • it is a complex gadget, equipped with a wide range of high quality expensive sensors, a colour display, wireless module and a rechargeable battery, making it an independent device (with no additional software required nor any smartphones to do its job). This is a professional device, with an expensive production chain but that's what you get so don't settle for anything less. 
We're also trying to fit any budget, this is why the project allows joining with a multitude of detectors. Our next goal is to build 2 simpler, smaller, lightweight and affordable  but still high quality, VOC and radiation detector models, in the near future, addressing them primarily to bicyclists and joggers and all people interested and supporting a cleaner environment. We're making it happen!


 

The uRADMonitor devices come with some amazing features:



Frequently asked questions
How do uRADMonior devices work?
uRADMonior devices are packed with powerful sensors, capable of detecting both the chemical and the physical harmful factors, that can impact our lifespan and cause life threatening diseases. Readings can be viewed instantly on the devices that have a display. All readings are centralised automatically on www.uradmonitor.com. Online data allows us to build graphs, stats and send automated notifications when certain thresholds are reached.
Who can benefit from these devices? Why should I get one?
Anyone, with or without a device can benefit from this project. The www.uradmonitor.com is available for free, offering valuable uncensored pollution statistics and graphs, around the world. If you want to get specific information on your own location you can purchase a device and by doing so you get to contribute to the entire network as well.Every day synthetic, toxic chemicals are released into the environment. The air is what we breathe; what travels through the air is what we inhale. As it ultimately affects the future of our planet and us, it is considered to be a global threat at huge cost to the environment.People with allergies, asthma, lung cancer or other respiratory diseases can benefit the most from these devices, as their health state might not give them the option to ignore excessive dust, pollen, high concentration of toxic chemicals or highly polluted traffic areas. Knowing the facts might be a life saver for people that are already ill and a good preventer for us all.
What is radiation?
Radiation may be defined as energy traveling through space. Non-ionizing radiation, like:microwaves, lasers, radio waves, infrared light, radar or ultraviolet light is essential to life, but excessive exposures will cause tissue damage, whereas all forms of ionizing radiation, like: the cosmic radiation that passes the atmosphere, x-ray used for screenings or the decay of radioactive isotopes especially found near uranium mines and nuclear plants, can cause damage to living tissue, and can result in mutation, radiation sickness, cancer, and death.
Radiation sources are found in a wide range of occupational settings like: airline crew (the most exposed population), industrial radiography, medical radiology and nuclear medicine, uranium mining , nuclear power plant, research laboratories. Massive particles are a concern for astronauts outside the earth's magnetic field who would receive solar particles from solar proton events (SPE) and galactic cosmic rays from cosmic sources.
The public also is exposed to radiation from consumer products, such as tobacco (polonium-210), combustible fuels (gas, coal, etc.), televisions, luminous watches and dials (tritium), airport X-ray systems, smoke detectors (americium), electron tubes, and gas lantern mantles (thorium). Air travel exposes people on aircraft to increased radiation from space up to 40 times more compared to the ground level.
How can radiation affect my health?
If radiation is not properly controlled it can be potentially hazardous to the health. Ionizing radiation — the kind that minerals, atom bombs and nuclear reactors emit — does one main thing to the human body: it weakens and breaks up DNA, either damaging cells enough to kill them or causing them to mutate in ways that may eventually lead to cancer.
What are VOCs?
Volatile organic compounds, sometimes referred to as VOCs, are chemicals that easily become vapours or gases, that contain carbon and are found in all living things. Along with carbon, they contain elements such as hydrogen, oxygen, fluorine, chlorine, bromine, sulfur or nitrogen.
Volatile organic compounds are released from burning fuel, such as gasoline, wood, coal, or natural gas. They are also emitted from oil and gas fields and diesel exhaust. Other sources include: solvents, paints, glues, and other products some of which can be used or stored at home and at work.
Many volatile organic compounds are also hazardous air pollutants. Volatile organic compounds, when combined with nitrogen oxides, react to form ground-level ozone, or smog, which can contribute to climate change.
Examples of volatile organic compounds are gasoline, benzene, formaldehyde, solvents such as toluene and xylene, styrene, and perchloroethylene, the main solvent used in dry cleaning.
Many volatile organic compounds are commonly used in paint thinners, lacquer thinners, moth repellents, air fresheners, hobby supplies, wood preservatives, aerosol sprays, degreasers, automotive products, and dry cleaning fluids.
How might I be exposed to volatile organic compounds?
Volatile organic compounds are common air pollutants found in most of the air. You can be exposed to volatile organic compounds outdoors by breathing polluted air that contains them. You are most likely to be exposed to volatile organic compounds outdoors in the summer, when the sun and hot temperatures react with pollution or during the foggy winter days,to form smog, causing various respiratory health diseases.
Indoors, products that contain volatile organic compounds release emissions when you use them, and to a smaller degree, when they are stored. You can be exposed to volatile organic compounds at home when you are cooking like grilling and frying or  when you use cleaning, painting, or hobby supplies products that contain VOCs. You can also be exposed if you dry clean your clothes with home dry-cleaning products; if you dry-clean your clothes at a professional dry-cleaner; or if you use graphics and crafts materials such as glues, permanent markers, and photographic solutions.
At work, you can be exposed to volatile organic compounds if involved with dry cleaning, in a photography studio, or an office that uses copiers, printers, or correction fluids. You can also be exposed if you work in chemical manufacturing or with petroleum-based products.
How can volatile organic compounds affect my health?
The health effects of volatile organic compounds can vary greatly according to the compound, which can range from being highly toxic to having no known health effects. The health effects of volatile organic compounds will depend on the nature of the volatile organic compound, the level of exposure, and the length of exposure.
According to the Thirteenth Report on Carcinogens published by the National Toxicology Program, benzene and formaldehyde are human carcinogens; perchloroethylene and styrene are "reasonably anticipated to be human carcinogens." People at the highest risk of long-term exposure to these three volatile organic compounds are industrial workers who have prolonged exposure to the compounds used at the workplace; cigarette smokers; and people who have prolonged exposure to emissions from heavy motor vehicle traffic.
Long-term exposure to volatile organic compounds can cause damage to the liver, kidneys, and central nervous system. Short-term exposure to volatile organic compounds can cause eye and respiratory tract irritation, headaches, dizziness, visual disorders, fatigue, loss of coordination, allergic skin reactions, nausea, and memory impairment.
How does dust affect my health?
Very small particles can be deeply respired into the lungs and remain there. 
These type of particles, small enough to be inhaled may cause: irritation of the eyes, coughing, sneezing, hayfever or asthma attacks.
Other dust-related, human-health concerns include airborne transmission of pathogens (bacteria, viruses, and fungus) and the compositions of certain hazardous dust particles.
Some minerals in dust are extremely hazardous, such as certain asbestiform minerals or silica because of their ability to lodge in lung tissue and promote disease such as lung cancer. Other minerals may contain potentially toxic elements, such as certain heavy metals.
Does the device detect pollen?
uRADMonitor Model D, does not have a specific pollen detector, but pollen particles would be detected just like other particulate matter.
How does CO affect my health?
Carbon monoxide, or CO, is a toxic gas that you cannot see or smell. CO is given off whenever fuel or other carbon-based materials are burned with insufficient air.
Breathing CO can cause headache, dizziness, vomiting, and nausea. If CO levels are high enough, you may become unconscious or die. Exposure to moderate and high levels of CO over long periods of time has also been linked with increased risk of heart disease. People who survive severe CO poisoning may suffer long-term health problems.
Scientists are not sure what the health effects are when a person is exposed to low levels of CO over a long period of time. Better tracking of CO poisoning and exposure can help us learn about the effects of long-term exposures to low levels of CO.
How does knowing all the pollutants I’m being exposed to, get to help me?
"Like in many other mornings, my wife was preparing the breakfast, she was making toast for the breakfast. I’ve made some tests with uRADMonitor Model D an evening before, and the device was still running in the kitchen. I instantly received a notification on my phone with VOCs being on dangerous levels. At first I thought it could not be all of the sudden and it must be a false alarm, since the device was in its beta testing days, but then I realised it was actually the toast producing all the harmful gasses. We stopped this harmful habit right away!
One morning we took a ride through the city to test the air quality with the newly mounted experimental setup. We gathered data from almost 2 hours of driving, even passing a few times through the same place. As you can see in the video, data was automatically sent and displayed on the mobile, although without a map it was hard to appreciate the readings on site. Once we arrived home I’ve mapped all readings and I was surprised so see that on one of the streets the radiation levels were gradually increasing as we approached a location and then they were gradually decreasing as we were driving away from that place, meaning there was some kind of radioactive source in there. It might have been the basalt or granite used for construction which can contain uranium or some kind of radioactive waste and I'm tempted to dig more on this problem.
In some of the days, especially when the temperatures dropped we were more tempted to skip house ventilation too often so VOCs levels, especially from cooking and use of certain housekeeping products were increasing high enough to receive an alert on phone. This worked as a great reminder to ventilate our home!"  said Radu Motisan
These are just a few of the situations we’ve faced since testing uRADMonitor, but normally we might have never guessed what's there. So the answer is definitely, YES! There are actions we can take in certain situations, to minimise air pollution around us, instantly.
Did you know?
Indoor air quality can be up to 10 times worse than outdoor?
Some of the most dangerous VOCs are CO, formaldehyde and benzene and the last two are found in diesel emissions?
Sooty, smelly diesel exhaust is more than just unpleasant -- it's a mix of more than 40 toxic air contaminants and has been linked to cancer, asthma and more than 21,000 premature deaths across USA every year. Many Americans live and work near diesel hotspots such as truck depots, bus terminals, ports, construction sites and busy roads and highways. Some studies have shown that kids riding inside diesel school buses can be exposed to higher levels of unhealthy diesel soot than people riding in nearby cars.
Formaldehyde is a cancer-causing chemical used for a number of purposes, including the manufacture of insulation, pesticides and disinfectants. But most industrial emissions of formaldehyde -- 42 percent -- are from the lumber industry, which uses adhesives containing formaldehyde to make plywood. Formaldehyde has been linked to lung cancer, and may also cause leukemia and asthma attacks. Diesel emissions also contribute to formaldehyde pollution.
To minimize formaldehyde exposures at home, make sure any wood furniture or fixtures that use particleboard are laminated or otherwise coated, choose exterior- rather than interior-grade pressed wood products for remodelling and be sure that areas where you are using products containing formaldehyde are well ventilated.
Used in motor fuels, solvents, detergents, pesticides and many other substances, benzene is a carcinogen that causes leukemia as well as a number of other illnesses. Virtually the entire U.S. population is exposed to benzene in at least small amounts -- at gas stations (it's in the gasoline), in diesel exhaust or from cigarette smoke, including second-hand smoke. Benzene also a problem in a number of workplaces, including oil refineries, coal-coking operations at steel mills, chemical processing plants, rubber manufacturing plants and laboratories, where it is often used as a solvent for other chemicals. You can avoid one significant source of benzene by stepping away from the gas pump when refuelling your car.
When you inhale microscopic bits of particulate matter -- otherwise known as soot -- fine particles can become embedded in your lungs and impair their function?
As many as 64,000 premature deaths occur each year from cardiopulmonary causes attributable to particulate air pollution. Most particulate emissions result from burning fossil fuels -- coal, oil, diesel, gasoline -- or wood. Old coal-fired power plants, industrial boilers, diesel and gas-powered vehicles and wood stoves are some of the worst culprits. High-temperature industrial processes such as metal smelting and steel production are also significant sources.
Everyone can help cut down on particulate matter pollution by conserving energy and choosing cleaner, more efficient energy sources for home heating and cooling, transportation, and appliances. Certainly, limiting your use of wood-burning fireplaces and stoves is a good start.
Exposure to radon is estimated to be the second leading cause of lung cancer?
It accounts for an estimated 21,000 lung cancer deaths each year (range of 8,000 to 45,000). Radon is a tasteless, colourless and odorless gas that is produced by decaying uranium and occurs naturally in soil and rock. The majority of these deaths occur among smokers since there is a greater risk for lung cancer when smokers also are exposed to radon.

The making of

Model D is new, and there is ongoing development on the software side, but that follows a predictable pattern. 
The only difficult challenge remains in making the project known, and spreading the network for increased resolution. And here you can help! Either by supporting this project and getting a detector, either by sharing it among your friends. Both count equally and we are greatful.
Our struggle doesn't end here: we're constantly involved in active research on better sensors and more hardware units. We've built a platform, and adding more sensors is the natural way to go, to include water quality.

A considerable amount of money will be spent on getting all required certifications and unit metrology tests in speciliased laboratories.
The future plans also include wearables, adding pollution trackers to devices increasingly smaller. With your help, we will get there! 


 
Get a unit, and join the network!
We've come a long way getting the project were it is today. It works and it does a great job, but we need your help to speed up the development and increase the coverage. 
It's very simple. Get a unit, and join the network. You get a dosimeter to monitor the quality of your environment 24/7, but you also support the work, and research, invested in this community project, helping it move forward.
The impact is huge. With each new unit, the project makes a step forward in its mission of delivering uncensored environmental readings worldwide!


Thank you!

story:
Short Summary of our Recovery Group


  • Secular Recovery (Ottawa) is run by a group of volunteers with a variety of backgrounds and experience in the field of addictions, psychology, and science. 
  • The goal of our campaign is to raise funds in order to provide safe space for secular support groups and those who struggle with addictions. Peer-support groups for those with substance control issues are absolutely critical to begin and maintain recovery, 
  • For over 70 years the predominant North American model for addiction support has been the 12-step program - Alcoholics Anonymous (AA), Narcotics Anonymous (NA), CA etc. This program is rooted in faith - the belief that handing over our problems to a "Higher Power" (called Him, or God in the 12-steps) will cure an individual's alcohol and/or drug problems. 
  • We know it is important for there to be more options out there for those who have trouble connecting with 12-step programs.
  • Contributing to our cause will help our organization grow and expand to a wider audience, saving lives along the way.

What Secular Recovery Ottawa Needs & What Your Donations Support


  • Our goal is to raise $3000. This will go towards various aspects of our peer- support group that will aid in making it a larger, more knowledgeable, and more effective program. Specifically, funds will contribute to:

  1. Room rentals that will house our support groups - we hope to open a second weekly meeting in Ottawa. Also in the near future, we hope to expand outside of Ottawa into other areas of Canada and beyond, and we have already started building a group in Montreal.
  2. We need to build our lending library to make the most recent scientific literature in the study of addiction and recovery available for clients to borrow.
  3. We have started "THE Addiction database A-Z" public database containing source articles, videos, podcasts, books, and much more that needs to be updated and maintained. It contains over 1.0 gigs of PDFs of original, peer-reviewed source literature for those studying addiction and keeps us on the leading edge of new treatments.
  4. Promotional material such as flyers, posters, business cards, and classified ads.
  5. Our organization's website (http://www.secular-recovery.org/).
  6. Our organization's Meetup site (http://www.meetup.com/Secular-Recovery-Ottawa/).
  7. A laptop computer and video projector.

      The Impact

      Your donation will help people who struggle with substance use issues who do not get the help they need in peer-support groups that are based on the 12-step approach (http://www.aa.org/assets/en_US/smf-121_en.pdf). There needs to be a group such as ours that follows a non-religious, non-judgmental approach and encourages being personally responsible for abstaining from substance abuse and associated behaviors.  In the last year we have become a dynamic organization, with a rapidly developing program that is firmly based on evidence of "what works".

      In the fall of 2013 we ran a successful online crowd funding campaign and we raised our goal of $1,100 CD. This funding allowed us to just rent a room for our group to meet, and for newcomers to join. However, after a year of successful meetings and growing attendance, we need this basic amount again and more to help reach those in need who are not aware of our support group.

      Testimonials: Here is a part of a long email from someone who only attended a few meetings, and we had not heard from him for almost a year, but who is now well on his way to recovery.

      "Thank you for being there for me a year ago. Over the course of my recovery and before that, whilst in the pit of despair, I have taken comfort in just seeing the emails you send. Even if I didn't open them some times, just seeing that you cared enough to keep me on that email list meant a lot, just seeing the emails was a reminder that I needed to get help."

        Risks & Challenges


        Secular Recovery Ottawa has overcome one of its first major hurdles in that we have managed to maintain a presence and grow in the last year. It is very difficult to get the message out that we are here amidst the still-prevalent view that one must go to AA or NA (12-step programs) to get sober. With greater funding we can reach out to help more people become aware that we are here through advertising and having promotions on our website (http://www.secular-recovery.org/), reaching more people through our Facebook page (https://www.facebook.com/secular.recovery.ottawa), through webpages such as (http://www.meetup.com/Secular-Recovery-Ottawa/) and even word of mouth by distributing business cards, pamphlets and books at more than one local meeting per week.

          Other Ways You Can Help

          You can ask to volunteer. We have a number of volunteer positions available that you can access on our website. Some of these positions do not need you to be physically in Ottawa and it is possible to telecommute. Tell anyone who may be interested that we are here in Ottawa, hoping to expand, and hoping to help more of those individuals who struggle with substance use.

story:
Weeli has huge potential! 


Thousands of apps are created every month and all are challenged with attracting and engaging new users.

Within 24 hours of it's public beta launch, weeli already had a community of several hundred international users who were signed up, adding places to their profiles and sharing with friends. 

We prioritized the most consistently requested improvements from around the globe and have already updated weeli with 5 out of the top 10 requested features. 

Bottom line: weeli has generated demand from a community of consumers who believe it has the potential to become a popular tool used by people like you and your friends, every day.

Be the first of your friends to use it! 

First, sign up and create your own weeli by adding some of your favorite places, like the pizza place you visit every week or the gym where you workout. 

Go to http://weeli.com to sign up for free. If you already have a few places in mind that you would recommend to your friends, you'll be ready to share your weeli in a couple of minutes. 


Why contribute time and money?

If you think weeli is a helpful tool that has the potential to build a really big community, you can help by donating and sharing the Weeli Indiegogo Campaign.

Consumers have validated that they are benefiting from using Weeli. Any financial support will only further validate its potential and help reach it faster.

story:
serious bagels queens

Our mission is to "clean up" the modern bagel and bring it back to the basics - free of nonsense and full of substance and taste. We have the knowledge and our goal is to bring our prototype artisan craft bagel to the masses with the development of the bagel microbakery to interested major health oriented supermarkets. The serious bagel has arrived!

Here at Serious Bagels Queens we produce the original New York artisan bagel daily with a new twist - NO dough conditioners or preservatives - NO white flour in our whole wheat. Eat it or freeze it.  After a 40 year career in artisan food this is my contribution to the people. Very healthy food can also taste very good. It is our mission to launch a sustainable brand that combines old world artisan craftsmanship with state of the art production techniques while remaining free of preservatives and dough conditioners.Our goal is to take this campaign national. The people have a right to know - what is in their bagel and what is now available to them. Our small army of artisans are dedicated masters because they love what they do. Where the artisan was once underpaid and overworked - we believe artisan dough masters are professionals and each production facility will be a school to supply a cluster of retail outlets. Ultimately we wish to establish artisan micro-bakeries in supermarkets throughout the country.

What We Need & What You Get

Our current need is $25,000.  We owe the contractors that built the factory and need the same people to continue the development of a true natural artisan bagel factory. Now there is a new issue with regard to connecting our mixer. In return for your support we can deliver a fresh supply of our bagel art - after we connect our mixer in January. We love what we do and need to expand our base of satisfied customers. If you don't live in the Queens area, your perks will arrive by UPS. 

If we don't reach our goal we will continue in our mission to bring our product to the people and show the world that tasty comfort food can also be healthy and delicious.

The Impact

After most of a career spent as a delicatessen & pizza food artisan I moved into the bagel world and was disappointed to find out that the original art form had become plagued with dough conditioners and preservatives.  I set out on a mission to fix this problem. This has now become my "Calling In Life" which has taken almost a lifetime to develop. Though we have perfected the artisan bagel we are not in a position to take it national and that is our ultimate goal. With your help we can bring our bagel art to the masses. By contributing to our campaign you will be helping us to spread the word. Though preservatives and dough conditioners have become an industry standard - they are directly related to profits before quality and purity. We intend to correct that problem. We believe that quality, purity, taste and profits can all co-exist.  When produced in our system the bagel is actually a very healthy bread product. It is only unhealthy to those with allergies to wheat, yeast or gluten. We have plans to bring out a gluten-free bagel but not yet. In the beginning we will focus on our very special whole wheat - whole grain line. !00% stone ground wheat - NOT white flour, NOT caramel color - no added sugar. The Bagel Truth Be Told! Our label tells the true ingredients. The lack of ingredients is our best ingredient! It's the way the original bagels were made.

Other Ways You Can Help 

If you like our idea and don't wish to contribute you could still help us to spread the word and improve peoples lives with healthier food choices. Comfort food can be healthy food. SERIOUS BAGELS to the People!

And that’s all there is to it. Just like our ingredients.

story:
We want people to know that good things have arrived when the THR truck pulls up because we give back. We are always looking for ways to help with non-profits, trail associations, community building and outreach, race coordinating, helping out other racers, and more! We have a lot planned for 2015, but we want to make sure we are supporting the causes that our community cares about. This is why we encourage members of our community to reach out to us and tell us where they want to see us giving back to the riding community. Please, let us know of events and other opportunities to help!

Short Summary

Trail Head Racing, from San Jose, California has become a successful and well recognized team in only two short years. Now it is time to take it to the next level! Four of our riders will be traveling the United States and Canada to gain National recognition, series titles, and wins. We cannot do it without your help! We don't expect to handed a free season, and are more than willing to put in as much work as it takes to complete our goals. With all of our riders on the national division of THR being in school, funding is one of the largest obstacle we have to overcome. A 2014 ProGRT season would have cost nearly $4000 in gas, and that doesn't include food and hotels for any of it. With this vehicle we are trying to cut hotel costs all together, be able to transport everyone in a single vehicle, and provide media coverage of all the events and races we attend. Another goal we have is to host more speed traps at races to help raise money for A Little 4 A Lot, and this large truck will help immensely with transporting the equipment needed to do this. This isn't aimed at the average person, rather companies trying to increase their presence in the racing scene, although we are more than happy to accept help from anyone and would like to help them in return. Being able to have a small portable bike shop at races, we can help other riders with maintenance at the races which are sometimes far from a bike shop. Another way of giving back would be media coverage of other up and coming riders, of companies who support the racers that dedicate their time to racing, and of the organizations such as the California Enduro Series that put on these great races. We would be glad to hear other suggestions on how we can give back to the racing and riding community so please, let us know.


What We Need & What You Get

Vehicles are a lot of responsibility. What we need:

The Truck: An e350 conversion with two parts, Garage and living Area

 

 


Insurance

Registration

A Generator

Tools

This will cost $12,000, not to mention gas!


Whats in it for you? 

Support up and coming pro racers

Opportunities for product reviews

Truck wall ad space as we travel the country

Media Advertising in all of our videos and articles


INVEST IN THE FUTURE OF YOUR SPORT!

 Aside from the obvious, like advertising and media marketing for corporate sponsors, there are benefits to the cycling community for investing in projects like this. Riding is our passion and we work hard to grow the sport. We hope to give back 10x as we receive in many ways. Some of these are working on race courses (such as this week with the Santa Cruz Super Enduro) building trails, product testing, assisting in getting your feedback as a rider through the proper channels so that companies will provide what you desire, and much more. With company support we can do a lot more for the things we are passionate about including: Trail advocacy, serving underprivileged communities, be a reputable voice for the cycling community while attending state and local meetings with cycling projects on the agenda, and create more fundraising events such as speed traps, contests, and races. We do work hard to earn our way through each season but we hope that getting a boost now will give us the opportunity to provide even more than we can on our own.



    The Impact

    Our team is made up of passionate and talented people. We are all students, racers, community builders, brand ambassadors, and huge supporters of all things good for the world of cycling. Even if we don't reach our funding goal, the money will still go towards helping our team reach as wide of a race schedule as we can, and help us to spread our cycling spirit as far as possible for 2015.


      Other Ways You Can Help

      Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

      • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
      • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

      Thank you for your support!

Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. Use the Indiegogo share tools! 
 Thank you for your support!

story:
Help me make it back Nationals in San Antonio Texas

  • I am a shotgun shooter and a college senior at Jacksonville University 
  • This funding will help me achieve my dream of performing at the top level in a discipline.
  • If I am able to go over the $500 I will put it toward buying a new shotgun, the shotgun will depend on how much money is raised

What I need to achieve 

  • I have been on the shooting team for only a year, and last time I went to Texas for nationals I was targets away from having the ability to go to the Olympic Training Camp.
  • If the goal of $500 is not reached, it will go toward the trip, and I will try to come up with the rest.  

The Impact

  • The money that is donated will help me in the chance of going to the Olympic Training Camp, which will be a direct result of your donations
  • While only shooting a year I have made leaps and bounds toward a higher score in my discipline. 
  • With this $500 fundraising, it will also cover trips from south florida all the way to Georgia and all the way west to San Antonio Texas. 

Risks & Challenges

  • Obstacles that I will face are of course, not being able to pay for the trip, and also performing up to my ability. 
  • Having the amazing coach that I have, he can help prepare and get me ready in time for Nationals in San Antonio Texas in the Middle of April. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Talk to people you know that love the shotgun sports 
  • I am also looking for sponsorships from businesses. 
  • Please use the Indiegogo tools to share to all of your friends.

story:
I fell on some hard times. and then hitch hiked across country, looking for and doing odd jobs as I went. now winter is approaching and I am living in a camper van on an acquaintances property. Has I have been unable to find any other work in over a month and find myself relying on charity, it is best I reinstate my commercial drivers license and go back to work.

I stopped driving and let my license lapse after a work place accident that compensation refused to cover me for. Without recourse I was left to recover from my injuries on my own. Now years later I have built my strength back up and have no choice but to go back to work.
story_txt: I fell on some hard times. and then hitch hiked across country, looking for and doing odd jobs as I went. now winter is approaching and I am living in a camper van on an acquaintances property. Has I have been unable to find any other work in over a month and find myself relying on charity, it is best I reinstate my commercial drivers license and go back to work. I stopped driving and let my license lapse after a work place accident that compensation refused to cover me for. Without recourse I was left to recover from my injuries on my own. Now years later I have built my strength back up and have no choice but to go back to work.

story:
Dauphins: A Bike Polo Team

We are the Dauphins, a hardcourt bicycle polo team based in Mobile, Alabama.  The three Dauphins are Kevin Greene, Bernard Hickman, and Jacques Chouinard.


Dauphins, as a team, was formed for the 2014 North American Hardcourt Bike Polo Championship (NAHBPC) qualifying series. We have been playing together for years, but this is the first year that we have officially come together as a team. We recently played together in the Southeast Hardcourt Bike Polo Qualifier in Atlanta, GA. We were lucky enough to place third, earning us a spot at the NAHBPC final tournament in Minnneapolis. We will be travelling there in July, where we hope to make our club and our region proud.  This is the first year that a team completely made up of Mobile players has made this trip, and we hope that our efforts will bring pride, recognition, and outside interest in both our club and the city of Mobile.

What We Need & What You Get


Our fundraising goal is $2,000.  This money will be used to pay for transportation (in the form of airline tickets) to Minneapolis for the three of us, our tournament registration fee, equipment and bike repair, and our housing costs.

What you get for donating:

  • $20 or more: a shout out on our Facebook and Twitter pages for you or your business.
  • $50 or more: a 4 inch design of your company logo, personal message, even your face proudly displayed on our jerseys during the tournament.
  • $100 or more: a 6 inch design of your choosing (within reason) on Bernard's or Jacques' wheelcovers during the tournament and a free Dauphins jersey.

If we don't reach our full goal of $2,000, we will use whatever money we raise to cover our expenses.  We are incredibly grateful for any help we can get, and we promise to use your donations wisely.


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that this is a huge thing to ask people for.  If you are unable to support us financially, help us out by liking us on Facebook and telling your friends all about us.

story:
Why a last chance campaign on Indiegogo?

Plainly speaking, we found that the original backers of the 1Hour Break® Indiegogo campaign were so fanatical (in a good way) about the campaign that they ended up becoming our most important group of brand ambassadors. Ultimately, when the campaign ended we had an overwhelming number of people expressing interest in 1Hour Break® and asking how they could still take advantage of the deeply discounted Indiegogo price. Until now, there was no other option for them, except to wait for 1Hour Break® to be available at retail.

With Indiegogo's Forever Funding Platform, InDemand, we're able to continue with the momentum of the campaign and offer continued discounted pricing on 1Hour Break® V2.0 to those who weren't able to hop in on the first wave.

For us it's more about the opportunity to help others redefine how the world handles stress and anxiety at a price point that won't break the bank.

Risks and Challenges

Since we're already shipping 1Hour Break® V2.0 to our original backers, we humbly submit to you that your risk is very LOW.

So go ahead and select the perk of your choice and we'll ship it out within 2-3 days! 

Thank you for your consideration.



We thank all of our supporters! Thanks to your contributions we have sold at least one bottle of 1Hour Break® V2.0 into every state in America and into 40 different countries worldwide!

We could not have done it without you!

Thank you,
The 1Hour Break® Family

Prototypes are here! 


Help us reach Whole Foods!


What is 1Hour Break®?

1Hour Break™ is the first all-natural, non-addictive, oral spray that eliminates stress and anxiety. It's designed for a modern lifestyle, as it is packaged in a convenient and purse-friendly bottle so you can have on-demand stress and anxiety relief--anytime, anywhere. It's really as easy as spraying in your mouth and swallowing.

It is safe enough to use for daily stress and occasional anxiety, but effective enough for those who suffer from chronic anxiety and panic attacks. 


All-Natural Ingredients

Formulated by the top herbalist in the United States, it is comprised of organic herbs—Kava, Lobelia, Passion Flower, Lemon Balm—which have been proven effective in relieving depression, stress, and anxiety for generations. 



How do I use 1Hour Break®?



1Hour Break® will change how the world handles stress

Our story


Meet the 1Hour Break™ Family! We are Andrew, Vu, Allison, Don... and Lola is our lovable pug and 1Hour Break mascot.

Our story starts while working in corporate America. We saw a destructive, downward spiral when people consumed and relied on dangerous products to deal with their stress-related issues: energy drinks, alcohol, cigarettes, processed food, medications. We were also victim to these same vices.

In life, we need to be free, to feel alive. Instead, we are addicted and sedated. We need an all-natural stress reliever that is safe, easily accessible, and effective. 


We went on a trip to Hawaii


During our trip, we came across Kava, an herb used for thousands of years in the South Pacific to calm nerves, relax muscles, and ease situations. Traditionally served as tea, Kava is highly respected and served as a peace offering between chiefs of rival tribes.

However, Kava is expensive and difficult to obtain, even more inconvenient to prepare and consume, and the taste isn't exactly yummy. So we wanted to introduce and present Kava as something sexy, something relevant, something that would fit seamlessly into our modern world.. 21st Century Kava.

In July 2013, under the guidance of the Kava Development Council and the top United States FDA recommended herbalist we produced a small batch run, tested our product concept, and launched our e-commerce site for 1Hour Break™ 1.0 (beta). 

The response was tremendous. We knew we had potential to help people, but never realized the extent of our impact until people started telling us 1Hour Break™ changed their lives. We want to continue to grow this movement; catch people when they need help, build relationships, and help people live more natural, healthy lifestyles. 


Why are we doing this?

We're not happy with the anxiety-relief options offered today. We believe that the last thing this world needs is another pill that come with a bunch of unpleasant side effects. Especially when there are natural options available!

      

Meet 1Hour Break™ 2.0

We took the feedback from our community, used it to perfect our formula, and we plan to deliver a new and improved 1Hour Break™ version 2.0.


How will your funding help us?


We're now raising $20,000, which will cover the cost of procuring our raw materials, bottling machinery, packaging and fund the manufacturing to allow us to produce 1Hour Break™ version 2.0 at enough scale to be able to offer it affordably to everyone. 

In return for your early support, you'll be one of the first to get 1Hour Break™ at an unheard of price, and support a community trying to redefine and improve the way the world handles stress and anxiety.

Please support and donate to our Indiegogo campaign. Spread the word to all your friends that you think could benefit from our product, share this Indiegogo campaign on Facebook and Twitter, so we can grow this family. And together, we can make this world a more healthy and holistic place. 

We have reach goals



Timeline

Questions? Please read our FAQ

*We expect to fulfill our crowd funding orders by Oct 2014. Delays are unlikely, but possible and we promise to keep our backers aware of every step in the manufacturing and fulfillment process.

*For International Supporters

For supporters outside the United States, please add $10 to any order $200 and under, and we'll get it shipped to you just the same. For any order over $200, please add $30. If there are any customs charges, to keep it simple, you will be responsible for your own customs. Thank you!

*For questions or customer service please email support@1hourbreak.com
or call 877-500-6005 ext. 2

*Press inquires please email Heather Rose at media@1hourbreak.com
