Today, the charity is run by very determined, caring and passionate volunteers.  The goal of this fundraising campaign is to raise enough money for the charity to provide a well-staffed day care centre and community for Alzheimer's sufferers and their families in Ghana.So please Help us to Make This Happen!

story:
VIVY relieves pain, eases muscle tension, improves joint mobility and speeds healing when chronic pain or joint injuries sideline your life. We're initially offering knee and back garments but will eventually add shoulder, wrist/elbow, ankle, and foot garments.

VIVY™ uses technology that relieves pain and promotes healing! This technology, diathermy, has been a standard form of treatment in clinical settings for decades. First discovered by Nikola Tesla and developed by the U.S. Navy, shortwave diathermy uses high frequency electromagnetic waves to transmit heat gently into muscle tissue, the source of your pain, which is a deeper level of heat than provided by heating patches and pads.

This gradual, deep penetrating heat increases blood flow to the area, cleaning out debris and accelerating the healing process. VIVY’s patented technology packs the previously cumbersome clinical application of diathermy into a safe, convenient, and ultra-portable product, intended for over-the-counter use.

This campaign is risk free! After receiving VIVY, try it out for 30 days. If you are not completely satisfied, you can return the device for a 100% refund. Also, if we don't deliver VIVY within 12 months of our campaign ending, we will refund your contribution.

The retail price of VIVY will be $299 for a back garment and $199 for a knee garment, but we're offering significant discounts on the purchase price during this campaign – up to 50% off retail value.

Join our e-mail list for campaign and product updates by clicking the button below:

More effective than heat patches and more portable than heating pads, VIVY will be the first product to offer the deep heating and healing properties of diathermy in a safe, simple-to-use device. VIVY is small enough to carry anywhere. And unlike patches or pads, VIVY provides heat that penetrates these layers and delivers relief directly to the source of your pain.

Find out more about diathermy from Dr. Cindy Trowbridge, athletic trainer, clinician, researcher, and associate professor at the University of Texas at Arlington:



Simple controls make VIVY easy to use. VIVY is a wraparound garment with velco straps that hold it snugly in place. Built-in sensors will let you know when your session is over.


VIVY provides pain relief so you can get back to being you. Shortwave diathermy uses high frequency electromagnetic waves to transmit heat gently into muscle tissue. VIVY’s heat doesn’t stop short.
In addition to pain relief and faster healing, VIVY’s deep heat can help keep soft tissue and muscles flexible, which leads to improved mobility. A session with VIVY before the gym can jumpstart cold and tense muscles. 
VIVY was designed with portability in mind. Take VIVY with you to the office, gym, and on that weekend getaway. VIVY’s power comes from rechargeable batteries, which free you from being tethered to an AC outlet.  
It’s been proven that shortwave diathermy promotes and accelerates healing. That’s why doctors, physical therapists, professional and collegiate sports teams, and the U.S. Navy Seals use it. And now, with your help, this same technology can be made available as an over-the-counter product.
VIVY makes pain management and healing smarter, easier, and more convenient with a smartphone companion app. You can schedule treatments, track your results after every therapy session, and get useful information and tips. 


  • Back Garment: 4" W x 60" L
  • Knee Garment: 4" W x 30" L
  • RF Frequency: 13.56 mHz
  • Duty cycle: 100% (continuous shortwave)
  • Therapy sessions: 15 min. - 30 min. (5 min. increments)
  • Power source: Rechargeable 6000 mAh Lithium ion battery pack
  • Estimated operating time on battery: Up to four 30 min. therapy sessions before charging
  • Recharge time: 2 hours
  • Charging connector: Micro USB


We need your help to bring VIVY to market and to build awareness of this innovative approach to pain management. The money generated from the Indiegogo community will help us prepare the prototype for production. Through this campaign, we also hope to educate consumers on the heating and healing powers of diathermy, spread the word about VIVY, and gauge consumer interest and demand for it. You can help us achieve these goals by sharing this campaign with your family and friends.

We also want to hear your thoughts and questions about VIVY to better understand your needs and wants in pain management. These insights will help us as we move towards manufacturing.

VIVY was created by ReGear Life Sciences LLC, a developer and manufacturer of therapeutic deep heating solutions for management of pain associated with injury and aging. Our products utilize shortwave diathermy technology originally developed by the U.S. Navy to warm SEAL team members and deep sea divers. In the past, we’ve reinvented diathermy technology in the form of portable generators and circumferential heat applicators. Now we are evolving diathermy once again with new coil applicator designs and micro-power requirements, to improve ease of use and effectiveness for consumers.

 
 

How many different VIVY garments are available? 

The first two VIVY products will be for the back and for the knee, thigh, or upper calf. Back pain and knee pain are two of the most common areas for chronic pain. We are developing additional garments for the shoulder and for smaller limbs like the wrist, elbow, or ankle. These will be available in the future.

When will VIVY be available? 

At this time, VIVY is an investigational device and is not yet available for sale. We have used our experience of manufacturing clinical diathermy devices to design and build the VIVY prototype and are now finalizing engineering to scale up for manufacturing. We expect VIVY to be available for delivery in Spring 2017, after review and clearance by the US Food & Drug Administration (FDA). 

Is there a time limit I can use diathermy? 

A typical treatment session with diathermy will be 20 to 30 minutes in duration. The VIVY session timer can be adjusted from 15 to 30 minutes in 5-minute increments. It can be shut off at any time, but will automatically shut off after the session length is reached. After a treatment session, diathermy should not be used again for at least 2 hours.

Where is this used in a clinical setting? 

Diathermy is routinely used in physical therapy clinics when the treatment goal involves therapeutic warming, for deep tissue pain relief, muscle relaxation, and tissue repair. In addition to VIVY (intended for consumer home use), we also make a clinical device called REBOUND, which has been used by physical therapy clinics, college athletic departments, and by many professional sports teams. 

Can I apply VIVY directly against the skin? 

VIVY is designed to be used over a thin layer of clothing – a shirt, tee shirt, exercise clothing or jeans, for example – but should not be applied over wet clothing or applied directly to the skin. Using the device over clothing ensures comfort and helps protect the skin from thermal effects.

Can VIVY get wet? 

As an electronic device, VIVY should not be submerged in water and should not be used when wet. Please consult the instructions for use on recommendations for cleaning VIVY.

Can I use VIVY if I have a pacemaker or another metal implant? 

Diathermy should not be used by people who have a cardiac pacemaker, implanted defibrillator, deep brain stimulator, spinal cord stimulator, or other metal implants. Even if the device has been removed, if the leads are still in place, the use of deep-heating diathermy could cause the remaining metal to heat up and could pose an internal burn hazard.

Who else should not use VIVY? 

Children under the age of 18 should not use short wave diathermy, because it may affect bone growth. Pregnant women should not use diathermy. You should also not use diathermy over an active infection site, an open wound, or areas of the body that are numb (thus can’t feel the heat). Diathermy should not be used if you have hemophilia or a blood clotting disorder, or for the treatment of the pelvic area if you have an intrauterine device, or during menstruation. Diathermy should not be used on or near the eyes and should not be used over abruptly swollen joints – wait until the swelling goes down to apply heat therapy.

Will VIVY be sold internationally? 

We are beginning with the US market but will expand globally based on consumer interest and demand.

Have additional questions not shown here? 

Please email our team at info@VIVYheals.com and we will respond as soon as possible.



Investigational Device – Not yet available for sale in the U.S.A. Users must read and understand the instructions for use and contraindications prior to using diathermy heat therapy. After a heat therapy session, VIVY must not be used again for two hours.

story:
About 

I am herbalist Djehuty Ma’at-Ra and I specialize in making the best herbal products (formulas) on the market and offer them to the global public at reasonable and affordable prices. People come first with myself and business, not profits. As a spiritual-preneur, I know profits follow people. 

I have been a herbalist since 1996 and I have engaged in business since 1999. 

I've had business partners which made my journey turbulent due to their lack of vision and not being grounded when money and success came, so I opted out of those businesses and went solo January 1st, 2016 with Djehuty Ma’at-Ra Herbs. 

While Djehuty Ma’at-Ra Herbs is a corporation with several shareholders, the vision of the company as far as product creation is in the sole hands of myself, which is what I most care about. The board of directors handle the business aspect which I’m totally cool with. Creativity and business are two different things (that do go together however in our world). The creative vision (product development) of the business is all mines to handle.

Many of my herbal formulations are controversial because I choose to use many herbs that are red flagged which in turn makes my business a high-risk business in the payment gateway industry which is responsible for allowing merchants to collect sales (money) online through the use of credit cards. 

My business recently went through some changes after the last payment gateway provider abruptly terminated our payment gateway account in late March 2016, claiming high risk.

This fundraising campaign ensures the existence of the business and the continuation of people being able to get the truly all-natural, high and superior quality herbs, and at the reasonable and affordable prices you don’t find anywhere else.

What We Need & What You Get

The goal is to collect $3k monthly. These funds go to maintain our facilities (and their utilities) whereby the products are created. We have three (3) facilities in total.

For your contribution, you get to receive a gift of these dynamic herbal formulations and other natural health products which I guarantee you’ll love. Guaranteed! They are the best!

Whether I reach the $3k goal or not, the funds will still go on the facilities, for any amount helps us as we navigate the business world without a payment gateway provider.

I’m in business and it costs money to engage in business. There are expenses galore.

Through donations, the challenge of allowing people to obtain the best herbs without a major payment gateway provider to make it easy for people to purchase the products online via a credit card, will be solved.

The Impact

It is very important to me personally that people be able to get high/superior quality herbs and herbal formulas at reasonable prices without breaking the piggy bank. Many people who desire to eat and be healthy often claim that eating healthy is expensive when the reality is eating unhealthy is what is truly expensive. 

Contributors to this campaign will help me achieve my vision of offering the best herbs at affordable prices to the masses of the people, especially the poor and economically challenged.

Risks & Challenges

There’s so much I could tell you about the challenges (which are indeed opportunities) I've overcome from personal business experience over the past decade.

In the past two months we have lost two payment gateway accounts (we have several). Ever since 2011, I have experienced losing payment gateway accounts over what makes absolutely no sense to me being outside of the payment gateway industry: excess sales (business) for a new business or start-up, which to this industry is considered suspect and thus high risk. I’ve also lost a few payment gateway accounts due to selling sexual health products too. C’mon! I can’t stop selling sexual nutrients. Sexual health and nutrition are very important. Some payment gateway accounts threatened to cancel accounts because of use of terms like “tumor(s)” (which is why I changed Fibroid Buster to Womb Formula). 

When I attempted to become a member with the BBB (for prospective customers only, to give them a sense of security with our business), my application was rejected. It was rejected because my metaphysical and energy products did not have worldly or secular scientific evidence of efficacy by worldly scientific bodies who don’t even test energy or vibrational tools or medicine, just like the FDA and pharmaceutical industries do not and will not ever test herbs for their therapeutic efficacy, simply because there is no money to be made in that which cannot be patented by a corporation, unlike with pharmaceutical drugs.

It is impossible to have a non-spiritual entity (a la government) to test a spiritual (or energy) invention for efficacy. The non-spiritual entity will write off the spiritual thing out of ignorance and disbelief. So, even though I could provide proof and was willing to do so, the BBB would not accept it due to the sources of the evidentiary data.

The BBB wanted me to get rid of these products in question, basically the products in the Energy Medicine and Alchemical Products category, but also those under Aromatherapy and you know I was not about to do that for some membership into an organization I do not need or need to be a member of. Again, any membership sought was on the grounds of prospective customers. That’s it.

Please know that it is your loyal support, patience, and understanding that keeps us sailing the waters of the Matrix doing business in a most unorthodox way, mixing spirituality, education, and business, a most tedious and challenging yet rewarding task. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute yourself, help get the word out. If not you, I know that you know someone who is in need of natural herbal healing products. Use the Indiegogo share tools and share with your family and friends on twitter, facebook and any other social media site.

A healthy diet and lifestyle is the best life insurance policy and one you get to benefit from while alive.

Let's do this People! Let's get free here in the Matrix! My history and tangible accomplishments speak for themselves. The time has come, people! Time to elevate! DONATE NOW!

Thank you for your support!

I’ve also lost a few payment gateway accounts due to selling sexual health products too. C’mon! I can’t stop selling sexual nutrients. Sexual health and nutrition are very important. Some payment gateway accounts threatened to cancel accounts because of use of terms like “tumor(s)” (which is why I changed Fibroid Buster to Womb Formula). 
 When I attempted to become a member with the BBB (for prospective customers only, to give them a sense of security with our business), my application was rejected. It was rejected because my metaphysical and energy products did not have worldly or secular scientific evidence of efficacy by worldly scientific bodies who don’t even test energy or vibrational tools or medicine, just like the FDA and pharmaceutical industries do not and will not ever test herbs for their therapeutic efficacy, simply because there is no money to be made in that which cannot be patented by a corporation, unlike with pharmaceutical drugs.

It is impossible to have a non-spiritual entity (a la government) to test a spiritual (or energy) invention for efficacy. The non-spiritual entity will write off the spiritual thing out of ignorance and disbelief. So, even though I could provide proof and was willing to do so, the BBB would not accept it due to the sources of the evidentiary data.
The BBB wanted me to get rid of these products in question, basically the products in the Energy Medicine and Alchemical Products category, but also those under Aromatherapy and you know I was not about to do that for some membership into an organization I do not need or need to be a member of. Again, any membership sought was on the grounds of prospective customers. That’s it.
Please know that it is your loyal support, patience, and understanding that keeps us sailing the waters of the Matrix doing business in a most unorthodox way, mixing spirituality, education, and business, a most tedious and challenging yet rewarding task. 
Other Ways You Can Help
 

If you are unable to contribute yourself, help get the word out. If not you, I know that you know someone who is in need of natural herbal healing products. Use the Indiegogo share tools and share with your family and friends on twitter, facebook and any other social media site.
A healthy diet and lifestyle is the best life insurance policy and one you get to benefit from while alive.Let's do this People! Let's get free here in the Matrix! My history and tangible accomplishments speak for themselves. The time has come, people! Time to elevate! DONATE NOW!

Thank you for your support!

story:
How often would you clean the toilet bowl when some member of your family did not flush the toilet after using it? How often would you get rid of a foul smell in your bathroom and get rust and limescale off the toilet bowl?  How much energy would you spend on cleaning? Are you tired of telling your kids to flush the toilet?  Free yourself from these worries - we have developed a compact and affordable automatic toilet flushing device – autoPusher!  


Each of us going to the bathroom having an automatic flushing system ever thought that it is so convenient! No unnecessary movements needed, the entire process does not need you to do anything. And I guess you ever thought: 'It would be so great if I had something like that in my home !'. But to mount such a flushing device you will have to spend a lot of energy and money. Besides, the mounting requires displacement of the wall, altering water supply valve system. Moreover, it would cost you 150$ or more, not everyone could afford it. 

                                                            Principle of work:   

  

                                                         There are 3 stages of work:

1 – It detects presence of an object in a 150-170 cm (60 - 67 in) zone.: You come in – autoPusher detects your presence.

2 – It waits until you leave the detection zone.

3 – Have 5 seconds passed after you left the detection zone? – It pushes the flush button. 

4 – If the both non-rechargeable and rechargeable batteries are low – the device pushes the button anyway.


 

                                   Easy and flexible mounting on any type of button



                                                    So, what does autoPusher have? 

autoPusher has a battery indicator! It will notify you that it's time to change the non-rechargeable battery or recharge the rechargeable one.

Doubt that it will fit your toilet tank? - The good news is that 90% buttons are made by standard and have the diameter of no more than 50 mm (approximately 0,2 in).

             Meet our 3 versions of autoPusher that will satisfy everyone's needs.

Comfort autoPusher has a PIR-based motion detector on its panel. 


Easy autoPusher has a PIR-based motion detector inside it.


Remote autoPusher has a RF module (radio frequency module) that enables a wireless connection to other devices. It works either with no connection or with a connection to an automatic deodorizing device - autoFresher.

                                 

Meet also a device that works with wireless connection to autoPusher Remote. This is a smart automatic deodorizing device – autoFresher! It deodorizes the air only when it's necessary - after the toilet flushing. 


                                            How does the autoFresher device look?

                                               Built-in flushing  system versus autoPusher. 


                                        Remember you about all version autoPusher




                                  Let us talk about the price of the autoPusher sets:

autoPusher is registered in ITC (Innovative Technologies Center) (Custom Union)! We forwarded documents for reception of PCT (Patent Cooperation Treaty from WIPO (Wipo). It will protect the copyright for device in 148 countries of the world.  

                                                    

                 

We take care of energy economy! When autoPusher is idle,it works in the power save mode !

                                                            The goals of fund raising!

1. Starting flow production and distribution around the world! So that everyone can make their life easier!

2. Further development of products for making life more convenient! One of them is a 'Comfortable cat toilet'. For people whose cats use same bathroom as they do.

3. Developing autoPusher and, more specifically, its work in connection with other devices! 

4. Part of the money will be spent on attracting other device manufacturers for modifying autoPusher's appearance

We actively work on development of autoPusher that can be mounted on a tank with water supply valve system.

                                           


                                                         Risks and challenges.

We've given a conservative estimate for our delivery dates. We are committed to keeping you informed of our progress both during and following our campaign. We assure you that we are all working very hard to produce a sensational product that not only arrives on time but is of optimum quality!

                                                                            F.A.Q

Q: In what colours is autoPusher offered?

 A: autoPusher Remote and autoPusher Comfort are offered in 4 colours. These are white, blue, green and red. autoPusher Comfort is offered only in white.

Q: In what colours is autoPusher Limited Edition offered?

A: autoPusher Limited Edition is offered in the listed colours + We can consider your suggestions.


Q: How long does the rechargeable battery work in a normal mode until recharged?

A: In a normal mode autoPusher works for 50-60 days until the battery recharged, if it is used by a family of 4-5 members.

Q: There are 10 members in my family, how long will the battery work until recharged?

A: In an intensive mode the batteries of 3AA type will work for 30-40 days. The rechargeable battery will work for 60-70 days until recharged.

Q: I finished using the bathroom but I don't want to wait until the automatic flushing works. What do I do?

A: For such cases there is a button of compulsory flushing.

Q: When does the automatic flushing start?

A: It starts 5 seconds after you have left the motion detection zone.

Q: What is the size of the motion detection zone?

A: The motion detection zone's size is 150 cm (60 - 67 in)

Q: I have to push my flush button with effort, will autoPusher be able to push it?

A: autoPusher has a unique mechanism. Despite its small size we managed to make it able to push a button with 3 kg to 1 cm (approximately 0.39 in) pressure.

Testing lasted for months and showed that this pressure effort is enough to push a most 'non-pushable' button.

Q: My button consists of two parts. Can autoPusher push it the way set by a manufacturer? Flushing different volumes of water.

A: autoPusher's pusher is made of soft material and can adapt to push such kind of button. However, we determined the volume of flushed water by creation of various autoPusher's working scenarios.

When you're staying next to autoPusher not for a very long time, the 'fast flushing' scenario works. If you're staying there for long, long pushing scenario works.

Q: Why is a replacement bottle of AutoFresher so small? Does it mean it will be sufficient for not long?

A: autoFresher deodorizes the air only in case you visited the bathroom. This is very effective and saves money. The volume of the replacement bootle will be sufficient for a longer period of time than with similar devices.

Q: Where can I buy a replacement bottle for autoFresher? What aromas do you offer?

A: For now we can suggest you to buy the autoFresher replacement bottles in our internet shop. Later - in every shop it will be offered in.

Currently we discuss with perfume companies the various aromas that will be offered. If you are interested we will consider what you think about it.



Most people resigned themselves to facing everyday problems...

But we did not! The 21-th century brings global technologies and at the same time we do not find enough time for doing all we want. You want to find time to do so much and not to waste it to solving domestic problems. This is why while facing everyday problems and worries we just need a helping hand in domestic routine, the one that will provide us with automatic toilet flushing. With the help of our device you will forget about the daily routine of flushing the toilet - it will do everything fot you! I don't ever think about it now, I have more important things to take care of...


                                            Follow us on:


                                                      autoPusher in the press

story:
Hi,

Do you wish every day were Halloween (or more importantly, are you sure it is)? Are you tired of using cosmetics and skin care that come in pink bottles and smell like perky bubble gum? Have you ever wanted to support a brand making the kinds of cosmetics and skin care you'd be happy to use? Here's your chance!

Beautiful Freak Cosmetics is a small goth-oriented cosmetics and skin care company currently making lip scrubs and lip balms. We're now looking to expand to soaps -- since that is what our customers wished for next (we didn't expect this...). However, the challenge with soaps is that making them requires ingredients and supplies we cannot use for any other purpose. That's why we're here on Indiegogo.

Who are you creepy people, anyway?

Beautiful Freak is made possible through the combined efforts of three friends - two designers in the US (Avril and Kasi), and a writer in Finland (Sonya).  We are old school goths, around for the beginnings in the 80s and 90s.  We're still here now, interested in creating makeup and skincare that appeals to folks in our little corner of the cemetery and perhaps as a reminder that you never have to stop being who you really are -- not at 30, not at 40, not ever.   Avril is also the owner of Club Gothika (the virtual goth club that's been the Greatest Show Unearthed since 2008), under her more familiar name (DJ Bronxelf)  and is also the industrial DJ for Nightbreed Radio, with extensive and deep ties to the goth and industrial music community. She does sets at Gothika 3x a week, plus two monthly shows for Nightbreed.

BF started out virtually, as a goth cosmetics company in Second Life.  Mostly this was because existing makeup options for goth folks were really limited.  It was frustrating, so we made our own. We named all our products after songs. It became an in-joke to all the real life goth and industrial folks, and everyone knew to look up the names to find the songs they'd never heard before. As a side benefit, a lot of people got exposed to some great music that way, which made us happy.   By the time we stopped producing new content for SL we had a terrific group of incredible supporters.  We are so grateful for all the love and confidence they gave us.  They gave us the opportunity and impetus to keep creating, and become better and more adventurous artists.

Due to the limitations of the Second Life platform itself, it was time to move on in 2014.  But as the song goes, evil never dies (to save everyone the search, it's a song by Diverje.)  In October of 2016, we rose from the dead to make the leap into the real world with our first test product.  The world did not end, and here we are now, trying to get our third off the ground. 

After creating lip scrubs and lip balms in deliciously dark and decadent flavors (still all named after songs!), we asked our customers what they wanted next and the answer was: soaps! (we *really* didn't expect that...)  That's what this campaign is about -- getting the supplies necessary to make those soaps for you, and to finance the growth of our company so we can continue to keep normalcy overrated.

Cool. So what do we get?

We have several sponsorship levels offering you all the soaps (and lip care) you could possibly need. One of the things we're most excited about is a soap we have planned as a limited edition just for May, in honor of World Goth Day (May 22).   20% of the proceeds from these specific soaps support The Sophie Lancaster Foundation, the charity we have supported extensively for several years' worth of Second Life events.  As of now, there are plans on the table for more charity soaps in June and October, too (different charities, but you get the idea). You won't want to miss these, so throw in a few dollars and make sure to darken the threatening daylight of spring with original, creepy products: made by goths, for everyone.

Why crowdfunding?

The plain truth is we can't do this without you.   Until now, we've managed to scrape things together without needing to crowdfund our products.  We didn't expect to have to do this yet.  But that's because truly, we did not anticipate the many requests for soap.  We're happy to make whatever people want most in their dark little hearts.  But soaps require a specific, particular investment, and we need crowdfunding support to get it going.  So please, help us make the soaps you asked for. 

The four scents we'll be starting with are two we already have in our product line - Coffee, Sex and Cigarettes, which is a scrubby hazelnut coffee, and Pink Orange Red, a juicy, refreshing blend of cranberry and blood orange.  In addition, we'll be introducing Faded Flowers, a floral containing lavender, vetiver, and lily, and our special for World Goth Day,  Illusion, a mixture of amber, clove and blood orange. We know (believe us) that people want others as well (like our very popular Bitter for Sweet, for example).  But none of this is possible without your help.

The $5- per bar price tag is unique to this campaign. The regular price of the soaps will be $8-.  So whether you get one bar or three, right now, there's a limited number of those $5- bars available. Once they're gone, they're gone and the price will start going up, so get them early!

Fly, my pretties, Fly!

Please spread the word! The bat courier service is not what it used to be, so make sure to share this on the social media of your choice.




We did it!  Thank you all so much from the bottom of our black little hearts. We're so incredibly grateful to everyone who pitched in and spread the word for us.  As promised, here's our first stretch goal:

If we surpass a total of $900,  we will add in a full size bar of Bitter for Sweet for everyone.  Bitter for Sweet is our insanely popular scrub and balm flavor, that smells like chocolate covered cherries.  People have been asking for it since the campaign began (The reason we didn't lead with it, for the record, was that the coffee in Coffee, Sex and Cigarettes makes for something exfoliating to give us a bit more variety.)  

What's after that?  No idea!  But we'll definitely think of something if we get there. :)   

4/23/17 11:17pm:

So we had to think of something faster than expected.  Wow.  THANK YOU.  This is amazing.  Okay.  So next stretch goal!  If we hit $1050, we will create a limited edition version of our new LE flavor, Sweet is Evil in soap form.  We hadn't intended on making one, but we will gladly do so for all our wonderful backers!  Sweet is Evil smells like lemon tea, perfect for summer.  Because of the tea, it also gently exfoliates as well, and leaves a fresh lemon scent.

-----

Third Stretch Goal!:

Ok gang, this is as good a time as any to announce the exclusive balm flavor for this campaign.  It's called It Is As Blackness Is, after a song by my favorite industrial band, iVardensphere. (because, iVardensphere. Im always happy to name things after iVardensphere songs.)  It's flavored with blackberry and almond.  It's dark, reminiscent of dark nights and even darker thoughts.  Because this stretch goal is a bit more complicated it's got a bigger goal to reach.  If we reach $1300, all backers will get both a 1/2 oz (tub) lip scrub AND a full size soap in this wonderful combination. I'd love to make this one actually, and Im creating the balm anyway for all those who backed at those levels. But this is a chance for everyone to get in one some scrub and soap action as well. 

 

Fourth (what?) stretch goal!

On to goal number FOUR!  We can't even. Seriously, thank you all so very much.  Every little bit genuinely helps us.  We started out as small as we possibly could, because we had no idea if anyone would want them at all. We never expected this.  Kasi and I keep looking at the total like 0.0.  (I don't think Sonya even knows yet- she's been buried under another project right now)

It occurred to me that I still had one regular flavor I hadn't offered to make in soap form, so let's do it now.  If we get to $1500, We'll make Sublime Ravings(which is my favorite, so there.) and toss a full size bar into all our supporters' goodie bags. 

Sublime Ravings (have I mentioned it's my favorite?) smells like ginger and lime. It also is the world's best creepy cupcake flavor.  Ginger is a natural antibacterial, and this combination will leave you feeling refreshed and wonderful. 

In advance, if we meet this goal the next stretch reward is really big (and also contains more charity products).  Let's see if we can get there together.

Keep sharing this as always. We couldn't do this without your help.  <3

 

Fifth goal? UNLOCKED.

We did it! We've hit stretch goal FIVE! Thank you all so, so much.  OMG. Thank you.   we could not have done it without you and we appreciate all your help so much. 

Stretch goal five is a big one.  Basically, if we reach $2000 (we have 20 days left as of this writing so it's doable.) we will donate 20% of the total stretch goal (which is $100 to be clear.) to the Sophie Lancaster Foundation outright.   In addition to that!  We will formulate an exclusive balm and scrub combo to go along with out WGD soap (it will be a little different since amber isn't really something you want to eat) and send the balm and scrub to all our backers. ALSO ALSO, everyone will get a full size version of  our last original regular soap scent -Sugar & Spice, which smells like dark spice cookies, heavy with ginger, cloves and cinnamon.

So please help us reach this next goal, freakbats! It's good for everyone, and you'll be helping to send an extra $100 to charity! 



Do you have a stretch goal suggestion? Let us know!

She does sets at Gothika 3x a week, plus two monthly shows for Nightbreed.BF started out virtually, as a goth cosmetics company in Second Life.  Mostly this was because existing makeup options for goth folks were really limited.  It was frustrating, so we made our own. We named all our products after songs. It became an in-joke to all the real life goth and industrial folks, and everyone knew to look up the names to find the songs they'd never heard before. As a side benefit, a lot of people got exposed to some great music that way, which made us happy.   By the time we stopped producing new content for SL we had a terrific group of incredible supporters.  We are so grateful for all the love and confidence they gave us.  They gave us the opportunity and impetus to keep creating, and become better and more adventurous artists.Due to the limitations of the Second Life platform itself, it was time to move on in 2014.  But as the song goes, evil never dies (to save everyone the search, it's a song by Diverje.)  In October of 2016, we rose from the dead to make the leap into the real world with our first test product.  The world did not end, and here we are now, trying to get our third off the ground. After creating lip scrubs and lip balms in deliciously dark and decadent flavors (still all named after songs!), we asked our customers what they wanted next and the answer was: soaps! (we *really* didn't expect that...)  That's what this campaign is about -- getting the supplies necessary to make those soaps for you, and to finance the growth of our company so we can continue to keep normalcy overrated.Cool. So what do we get?We have several sponsorship levels offering you all the soaps (and lip care) you could possibly need. One of the things we're most excited about is a soap we have planned as a limited edition just for May, in honor of World Goth Day (May 22).   20% of the proceeds from these specific soaps support The Sophie Lancaster Foundation, the charity we have supported extensively for several years' worth of Second Life events.  As of now, there are plans on the table for more charity soaps in June and October, too (different charities, but you get the idea). You won't want to miss these, so throw in a few dollars and make sure to darken the threatening daylight of spring with original, creepy products: made by goths, for everyone.Why crowdfunding?The plain truth is we can't do this without you.   Until now, we've managed to scrape things together without needing to crowdfund our products.  We didn't expect to have to do this yet.  But that's because truly, we did not anticipate the many requests for soap.  We're happy to make whatever people want most in their dark little hearts.  But soaps require a specific, particular investment, and we need crowdfunding support to get it going.  So please, help us make the soaps you asked for. The four scents we'll be starting with are two we already have in our product line - Coffee, Sex and Cigarettes, which is a scrubby hazelnut coffee, and Pink Orange Red, a juicy, refreshing blend of cranberry and blood orange.  In addition, we'll be introducing Faded Flowers, a floral containing lavender, vetiver, and lily, and our special for World Goth Day,  Illusion, a mixture of amber, clove and blood orange. We know (believe us) that people want others as well (like our very popular Bitter for Sweet, for example).  But none of this is possible without your help.The $5- per bar price tag is unique to this campaign. The regular price of the soaps will be $8-.  So whether you get one bar or three, right now, there's a limited number of those $5- bars available. Once they're gone, they're gone and the price will start going up, so get them early!Fly, my pretties, Fly!Please spread the word! The bat courier service is not what it used to be, so make sure to share this on the social media of your choice.We did it!  Thank you all so much from the bottom of our black little hearts. We're so incredibly grateful to everyone who pitched in and spread the word for us.  As promised, here's our first stretch goal:If we surpass a total of $900,  we will add in a full size bar of Bitter for Sweet for everyone.  Bitter for Sweet is our insanely popular scrub and balm flavor, that smells like chocolate covered cherries.  People have been asking for it since the campaign began (The reason we didn't lead with it, for the record, was that the coffee in Coffee, Sex and Cigarettes makes for something exfoliating to give us a bit more variety.)  What's after that?  No idea!  But we'll definitely think of something if we get there. :)   4/23/17 11:17pm:So we had to think of something faster than expected.  Wow.  THANK YOU.  This is amazing.  Okay.  So next stretch goal!  If we hit $1050, we will create a limited edition version of our new LE flavor, Sweet is Evil in soap form.  We hadn't intended on making one, but we will gladly do so for all our wonderful backers!  Sweet is Evil smells like lemon tea, perfect for summer.  Because of the tea, it also gently exfoliates as well, and leaves a fresh lemon scent.-----Third Stretch Goal!:Ok gang, this is as good a time as any to announce the exclusive balm flavor for this campaign.  It's called It Is As Blackness Is, after a song by my favorite industrial band, iVardensphere. (because, iVardensphere. Im always happy to name things after iVardensphere songs.)  It's flavored with blackberry and almond.  It's dark, reminiscent of dark nights and even darker thoughts.  Because this stretch goal is a bit more complicated it's got a bigger goal to reach.  If we reach $1300, all backers will get both a 1/2 oz (tub) lip scrub AND a full size soap in this wonderful combination. I'd love to make this one actually, and Im creating the balm anyway for all those who backed at those levels. But this is a chance for everyone to get in one some scrub and soap action as well.  Fourth (what?) stretch goal!On to goal number FOUR!  We can't even. Seriously, thank you all so very much.  Every little bit genuinely helps us.  We started out as small as we possibly could, because we had no idea if anyone would want them at all. We never expected this.  Kasi and I keep looking at the total like 0.0.  (I don't think Sonya even knows yet- she's been buried under another project right now)It occurred to me that I still had one regular flavor I hadn't offered to make in soap form, so let's do it now.  If we get to $1500, We'll make Sublime Ravings(which is my favorite, so there.) and toss a full size bar into all our supporters' goodie bags. Sublime Ravings (have I mentioned it's my favorite?) smells like ginger and lime. It also is the world's best creepy cupcake flavor.  Ginger is a natural antibacterial, and this combination will leave you feeling refreshed and wonderful. In advance, if we meet this goal the next stretch reward is really big (and also contains more charity products).  Let's see if we can get there together.Keep sharing this as always. We couldn't do this without your help.  <3 Fifth goal? UNLOCKED.We did it! We've hit stretch goal FIVE! Thank you all so, so much.  OMG. Thank you.   we could not have done it without you and we appreciate all your help so much. Stretch goal five is a big one.  Basically, if we reach $2000 (we have 20 days left as of this writing so it's doable.) we will donate 20% of the total stretch goal (which is $100 to be clear.) to the Sophie Lancaster Foundation outright.   In addition to that!  We will formulate an exclusive balm and scrub combo to go along with out WGD soap (it will be a little different since amber isn't really something you want to eat) and send the balm and scrub to all our backers. ALSO ALSO, everyone will get a full size version of  our last original regular soap scent -Sugar & Spice, which smells like dark spice cookies, heavy with ginger, cloves and cinnamon.So please help us reach this next goal, freakbats! It's good for everyone, and you'll be helping to send an extra $100 to charity! Do you have a stretch goal suggestion? Let us know!

story:
Remember: I hate reading this more than you do.

I don't like that I have to fundraise on IndieGoGo for my Mom's funeral, but my Dad and I are desperate for money now, and we need your help.

My Mom is a strong fighter and has been battling cancer for several years. It devastated me when I found out she had breast cancer. However, she was treated for it, and it was removed. My father and I were overjoyed. A couple of months ago-just before my birthday-I found out horrifying news that my Mom kept a secret from me to protect me.

My Mom now has 4 types of cancer.

Brain Cancer

Lung Cancer

Liver Cancer

Bone Cancer

This is sad and devastating to my Dad and I. We took care of her, and she fought it so, so hard. The last few months have been rough, but we never gave up hope and faith.

Last week she was not herself. She was breathing heavy and I was very concerned. After trial and error of calling the doctors, they finally said "Take her to emergency right now!" My Mom resisted and finally gave in. Getting my Mom who could no longer walk, think, talk, laugh, and now breathe to the hospital was the hardest thing I've ever had to do. I now realize it was my last drive anywhere with my Mommy.

She was so scared, but I kept her calm and rushed her to the emergency room as fast as possible. Talking about vacations we went on, and promising that Jesus Christ is here for us. I know she knows how much I love her and want to take care of her.

The Emergency Room put her on oxygen to help her breathe. For a moment, I saw my Mom smile again like her old self. I was so happy and relieved.

Suddenly the doctors were in panic. She has pneumonia and blood clots in her lungs and it's running through her body. They put her on life support and sedated her.

The doctors told my Dad and I that she is not going to make it.

 

I was the last thing she saw before she closed her eyes.

 

My Mom has always been the greatest Mom in the world to me. Being an only child, I feel blessed to have such a great Mom. I never knew anyone else so caring, loving, and devoted to their son as much as my Mom. She has always been the most positive person I know, and she was always there for me. She loves life and talking to everyone she meets. Always having a great sense of humor even in the toughest situation. She always listened to me, supported me, and gave me uplifting great advice. She was always there for me. She was always amazed by what I've accomplished in my life. She's my greatest supporter. She has given me endless love my entire life that nothing will ever take away from me. No words can describe the special bond I have with her. No words can show how much I love my Mom.

 

My Mom deserves a proper funeral. She has been through so much in her life. I owe it to her to respect her wishes and give her a nice tomb stone.

I don't know how much time I have left.

My Dad and I are desperate and helpless. This week was worse than I thought it would be. We are devastated. We are confused. We need help fast.

I'm not asking you to donate. I'M BEGGING YOU! PLEASE help my family during this horrible time in our lives. I will pitch in as much as I can, but it's not enough. I know how much funerals cost from my wonderful Grandfather passing away 2 years ago, and we simply cannot afford it. She does not wish to be cremated or buried in an unmarked grave that the hospital provides. She wants to be remembered. We want her to be remembered. We love her more than anything. PLEASE HELP MY FAMILY!

PLEASE PRAY FOR MY MOM, DAD, AND I! GOD BLESS YOU AND YOUR FAMILY ALWAYS!

story:
Our goal IS $8000. However, this campaign is apart of a non-profit organization and as an organization our goal is endless. The initial $8000 would help us to give fairings to two amputees. Read more below to find out all about us!

Check us out beyond Indiegogo @ www.f4a.us or on:

Facebook (facebook.com/Fairings4Amps),
twitter (@Fairings4Amps),
YouTube (youtube.com/Fairings4Amps)


What is a Fairing and what is an Amp?

A Fairing is…

a specialized covering that surrounds an existing prosthetic leg, accurately recreating the body form through a process that uses three-dimensional scanning and printing. I first encountered this product at the Amputee Coalition's national conference in Kansas City in June at the Bespoke Innovations booth. They are the coolest and most necessary prosthetic items I have come across since I lost my leg and was very disappointed to learn they weren’t covered by insurance.

 

An Amp is….

simply an Amputee.

 

Why is this so important to F4A?

There are thousands of amputees in America whose lives would improve overnight by receiving a prosthetic fairing. Our goal is to provide these fairings to as many amputees worldwide as possible, starting first at home and spreading our reach out as we go. To do so we need everyone's help spreading the word about what we are doing. That means that we would really appreciate all of your shares, likes, and tweets which will help us get some attention and hopefully more donations for our wonderful purpose and organization. Genuinely, thank you very much for each of those shares, likes, and tweets. Each one has such a great potential to bring so much to those we hope to help.

John Maynard’s Story

Continuing with why this is all important to F4A, I would like to introduce John Maynard. Trent met John at the Amputee Coalition 2011 National Conference. This is John’s story by his own account:

When I was eight years old my mother yelled at me to stop hopping on one leg. She had taken me and my cousin grocery shopping with her, and as is typical with younger children, we had subsequently become bored. So, we concocted several contests to perform amongst ourselves, all in an attempt to entertain ourselves. One was to see how long we could walk on our heels, with the object being to be the one who walked longest. One had been to see who could hold their breath the longest. And one, well, it had been to see who could go the longest without putting their second foot down. So for almost a minute my mother pushed a shopping cart down the aisle, closely followed by two hopping adolescents. That is, until she turned around and yelled at us to stop hopping on one leg, as it might cause us some kind of “irreversible damage.” Yes, when I was eight, my mother yelled at me to stop hopping on one leg. Now, 13 years later, hopping on one leg is my way of life.

            I took a job working for a recycling plant in Orlando, FL , when I was 19 years old. It was an awesome job for a young adult with hardly any college under his belt, as it paid $9 an hour for forty hours a week, plus typically an additional 20 hours of overtime, and it also gave me a chance to do “a real man’s work,” something I had desired for a long time. I was lead baler, and in a nutshell my job was to run the baling machine and subsequently make all the bales that we sold, thereby singlehandedly providing the source of income for the company. My boss’s exact words had been, “John, the speed and quality of your work directly correlates with how much money this company makes, as we only make money from bales, and you are the lead person making them.” It was a lot of responsibility, and for me, well, that was pretty cool. Around early June my company started up a night shift and I was tasked to work it. This meant working half the shift in a full plant, with managers and supervisors around, but then the remaining half the shift under no supervision whatsoever. It would be just me and my two crew members. It brought with it a sense of prestige as it meant I had proved myself enough that they trusted me to work without anyone breathing down my neck. This prestige was short lived.

            July 9th 2010, around 7:15pm, my baling machine became jammed. After working on clearing the jam for a few minutes, I managed to unclog the machine when suddenly I heard the motors kick on. Before I could do anything, the compacting ram began moving towards me. I quickly jumped up and pulled myself out of the way of the moving ram, holding my body up and hovering over the moving piece of heavy machinery. Unfortunately, my right boot was not up far enough and the ram managed to catch it by the very bottom of my boot’s sole. Pulling me back down and onto the top of the ram, it pulled my leg closer and closer to the teeth, until it disappeared out of sight. Suddenly a splitting pain shot up my leg as I felt my foot get crushed all the way up to my shin. At this point, my leg became severed. I pulled myself up and out of the machine, and radioed for help. Suddenly, not having an entire plant full of coworkers was no longer a cool thing, as no one heard my screams. Grabbing my cell phone, I dialed 911 myself. At 7:23pm the Orange County Police Department answered the phone and thus began the longest 16 minutes of my life as I fought to stay alive long enough for them to find me.

            It has been one year since my accident. My amputation level is 6 inches below my knee, and I walk great with a prosthetic. I run, rock climb, and will even be starting the Police Academy soon. My life is not all that different than it used to be, but at the same time it’s nothing the same. When you put on your shoes in the morning, I put on my leg. But, I am grateful to be alive, and I’m making the most out of my situation. I even have successfully started a YouTube account helping out other amputees. www.YouTube.com/crew9t started as a coping mechanism, but has grown to a full on hobby. If I had to go back and do it all again, yes, I would definitely save myself from entering the machine. But knowing that I cannot undo what is done, I can honestly say that I am very happy with where I am today and would not change a thing about my current situation. My accident has changed my outlook toward the world, and I feel that my goals and even my way of thinking have changed too.  My goal now is to help encourage other amputees to continue on with their lives. Just because you lose a limb does not mean that you should lose your life. I want to show any amputees struggling with their situation that life does go on, and it can be better than you ever could have imagined.

Trent Waggoner’s Story

Here is Trent’s story from his own account:

September 7, 2010 started out as normal as any other day. I got up early and dragged myself into an 8 a.m. class at the University of Louisville. On the way home from class I stopped to help a lady with a flat tire. While helping change the tire, I was suddenly struck by a reckless driver. As the vehicles slid to a stop I tried to gather my thoughts. I had no clue what had just happened or the extent of my injuries.  After regaining my bearings, I knew I was in trouble but I was still alive.  One after the other, people began stopping their cars and rushing out to help us.  God blessed me and those around me that day. As people began to help, I realized very rapidly that my guardian angel was over me that day. People who stopped to help me that day included a UPS Airline Pilot, a nurse (also the wife of one of the worship leaders at my church), a past youth minister, the lady I was helping (now my Aunt Janet), and the lady that hit my truck. During the next 42 days at the University of Louisville Hospital I had 11 major surgeries, plenty of sleepless nights, weeks without an appetite, and more than my fair share of pain, both physically and emotionally.  As is the case with many people who go through traumatic situations in their lives, I began to appreciate all the great things that happened to me as a part of this experience - I bonded with my fiancée who I have been with for about 2 1/2 years, got closer to most of my family and friends than ever before, and met some amazing people such as nurses, doctors, lawyers, athletes, and many many others that really exemplified the greatness of the human spirit.  I have changed the way I look at the world and feel that my priorities have changed too.  My goal now is to help change the outlook that other amputees have on their own limbs. I sincerely want to help make those other amputees feel confident in who they are and how others perceive them.

Update: One of the greatest accomplishments for myself since my accident was just recently when I was able to propose to my girlfriend of two and a half years in traditional fashion by getting down on one knee. You can see the proposal in my picture above!

What We Need
There are thousands of amputees in America whose lives would improve overnight by receiving a prosthetic fairing. Our goal is to provide these fairings to as many amputees worldwide as possible, starting first at home and spreading our reach out as we go. To do so we need everyone's help spreading the word about what we are doing. That means that we would really appreciate all of your shares, likes, and tweets which will help us get some attention and hopefully more donations for our wonderful purpose and organization. Genuinely, thank you very much for each of those shares, likes, and tweets. Each one has such a great potential to bring so much to those we hope to help.

To accomplish our mission we need to receive about $4000 in donations for each amputee we assist. This means that we need all of your help you can give donating as well as doing all of the tweeting and tagging possible to make sure we are spread all across Facebook, Twitter, Indiegogo, LinkedIn, wherever possible! Thanks so much for continuing to support us and we appreciate both your time and your money and how you are choosing to put it towards such a great cause with our organization!

Finally, I will personally say, for those that are curious, that I was not asked by Bespoke or any other company that makes prostheses to do this. I simply feel that I can make a difference in many amputees’ lives by helping them get these Fairings that have such huge emotional benefits.  I am excited to start this campaign and am truly grateful for any donations you make to help me and other amputees.

suddenly struck by a reckless driver. As the vehicles slid to a stop I tried to
gather my thoughts. I had no clue what had just happened or the extent of my
injuries.  After regaining my bearings, I knew I was in trouble but I was
still alive.  One after the other, people began stopping their cars and
rushing out to help us.  God blessed me and those around me that day. As
people began to help, I realized very rapidly that my guardian angel was over
me that day. People who stopped to help me that day included a UPS Airline
Pilot, a nurse (also the wife of one of the worship leaders at my church), a
past youth minister, the lady I was helping (now my Aunt Janet), and the lady
that hit my truck. During the next 42 days at the University of Louisville
Hospital I had 11 major surgeries, plenty of sleepless nights, weeks without an
appetite, and more than my fair share of pain, both physically and
emotionally.  As is the case with many people who go through traumatic
situations in their lives, I began to appreciate all the great things that happened
to me as a part of this experience - I bonded with my fiancée who I have been
with for about 2 1/2 years, got closer to most of my family and friends than
ever before, and met some amazing people such as nurses, doctors, lawyers,
athletes, and many many others that really exemplified the greatness of the
human spirit.  I have changed the way I look at the world and feel that my
priorities have changed too.  My goal now is to help change the outlook
that other amputees have on their own limbs. I sincerely want to help make
those other amputees feel confident in who they are and how others perceive
them.
Update: One of the greatest accomplishments for
myself since my accident was just recently when I was able to propose to my
girlfriend of two and a half years in traditional fashion by getting down on
one knee. You can see the proposal in my picture above!
What
We NeedThere are thousands of amputees in
America whose lives would improve overnight by receiving a prosthetic fairing.
Our goal is to provide these fairings to as many amputees worldwide as
possible, starting first at home and spreading our reach out as we go. To do so
we need everyone's help spreading the word about what we are doing. That means
that we would really appreciate all of your shares, likes, and tweets which
will help us get some attention and hopefully more donations for our wonderful
purpose and organization. Genuinely, thank you very much for each of those
shares, likes, and tweets. Each one has such a great potential to bring so much
to those we hope to help.
To accomplish our mission we need to
receive about $4000 in donations for each amputee we assist. This means that we
need all of your help you can give donating as well as doing all of the
tweeting and tagging possible to make sure we are spread all across Facebook,
Twitter, Indiegogo, LinkedIn, wherever possible! Thanks so much for continuing
to support us and we appreciate both your time and your money and how you are
choosing to put it towards such a great cause with our organization!
Finally, I will personally say, for those that are curious, that I
was not asked by Bespoke or any other company that makes prostheses to do this.
I simply feel that I can make a difference in many amputees’ lives by helping
them get these Fairings that have such huge emotional benefits.  I am
excited to start this campaign and am truly grateful for any donations you make
to help me and other amputees.

story:
Our Story

Dear Friends,

This is a heartfelt, personal appeal to ask you to help a little girl in Thailand who has lost her eyes to cancer.
Her name is Pun Pun.  She is only eight months old. 

I met baby Pun Pun's mother during a recent trip to Bangkok.  Her name is Patcharee.  She is a buffet server in the hotel where I stay on my many trips there.  She is trying to help her daughter on meager wages and without the help of her husband, who has abandoned the family: Patcharee, baby Pun Pun and another daughter, who is eight years old.

Imagine being a poor single mom struggling to support two little girls, one of whom has just had her eyes removed and now needs chemotherapy. 

Fortunately, baby Pun Pun's bilateral retino blastoma was detected early. She has an excellent chance of survival with the proper treatment and care. But she will be blind the rest of her life.

Because Patcharee could not afford hospital care in Bangkok, she had to take Pun Pun to Chaing Mai, a 12-hour bus trip to the north.  Patcharee is now commuting between her part-time hotel job in Bangkok and the hospital in Chaing Mai  where Pun Pun awaits chemotherapy.

My goal is to raise money for Patcharee so that she can be by baby Pun Pun's side throughout the chemotherapy process without having the additional stress of working and traveling so that she can provide for her older daughter, herself and baby Pun Pun's growing expenses.

As baby Pun Pun is now surrounded by complete darkness, she needs her mother there every hour of every day and night - if for nothing else then to sense her mother's presence, hear her voice and the comfort of her touch during this frightening and tumultuous time in her young life. With your help, we know we can improve the quality of baby Pun Pun's life. Mother and daughter should not be separated at such a crucial time. 

Pun Pun and her mother have captured my heart, as I'm sure they have captured yours.  Won't you help them get through this ordeal and give baby Pun Pun and Patacharee hope for a better future?

It's in our hands to help. Any donation your able to make is greatly appreciated. Thank you for your support! 

Very Sincerely,

Ron Serle

story:
INTRO

My name is Dr. Eden Goldman and I've got a secret to tell you.  Actually, I've got a whole book of secrets to tell you.  My new book THE SECRET ART OF ADJUSTING YOGA POSES is an awesome, heart-inspired project that I've been working on for the last year and have been dreaming about doing since I first began teaching Yoga over a decade ago.  The best part is, I get to share this work and these secrets with all of you here on IndieGoGo and I have until 12/12/12 to do it!  O:-)


ABOUT THIS PROJECT

My book, The Secret Art of Adjusting Yoga Poses, is an easy to follow step-by-step guide that introduces masterfully refined hands-on techniques for assisting more than 50 Yoga poses!  With beautiful photos and detailed descriptions, it's a book that every Yoga instructor and serious practitioner of Yoga will want to own.  As a Chiropractor and a lifelong yogi, I'm sharing this valuable information to artistically bring together both the Eastern world of the healing arts and the Western world of biomechanical sciences and sports medicine.  I feel (like so many others) that adjustments and assists is a major area of need in the Yoga community and decided it was time to do something about it. 

Inside the book, I discuss Yoga asana adjustments for a variety of skill levels from beginner to advance as well as assists for different types of bodies.  Bigger, smaller, wider, taller...you name it!  Just like using any other tool, knowing which assist to apply when and on what type of body can transform the experience for both the practitioner AND the Yoga teacher into something that is profoundly inspiring, deeply connecting and sacred.  Some poses in the book even have as many as 7-8 different techniques.  I can wholeheartedly guarantee that you will learn something new!  My intention in sharing this with you is to keep people safer when giving and receiving asana assists so that everyone enjoys Yoga more.  In this way, I hope my book is of huge benefit to Yoga practitioners and teachers all across the world.


LAYOUT SNEAK PEEK

In the next few months, all the final details of the book will be complete.  The layout is already set up and looks great.  Check out a sample:



As you will see in the level of detail above, setting up the pictures and formatting for this 250+ page book took a long time and a lot of work.  It was totally worth it.  I think you're going to love it!  Here are some pictures of other poses in the book that were taken by L.A. photographer Marie Stein:


         

        


The pictures look pretty amazing, right?!?  The bigger, higher resolution photos and layout images are available in the media gallery.  O;-)  We had a lot of fun creating them.  I'm at the point now where I have people to compensate for their hard work and assistance in bringing this book to life.  Of course, there are publishing fees house, too.  This where YOU come in.  I'm counting on your kindness and generosity here on IndieGoGo!


WHERE YOUR $$$ GOES

I want my supporters on IndieGoGo to know where their $$$ is going.  So here are the rough financial breakdowns highlighting where your generous contributions are being applied to help support my project...

The Secret Art of Adjusting Yoga Poses
Cost Breakdown

Photographer $1000
Artistic Director $1000
Graphic Artist $2200
Copy Editor $1000
Black and White Book Copies $2295
Full Color Book Copies $2905
Packing and Shipping $400

Total $10800


WHAT YOU GET FOR YOUR SUPPORT

I've created lots of ways that you can support my campaign.  Check out the awesome perks:

Copies of the book in both black and white and full color
Your name in the book
Original artwork
Chiropractic, massage and Yoga therapy sessions
Traditional Yoga music
Entrance into workshops
Host a Workshop
Rent a Yoga Doctor for the day!

As you can see there are lots of incredible perks so I hope you find something that inspires you to contribute.  You can also make a love donation and pay it forward for the Yoga community knowing that you're offering good vibes and safe and healthy practices to other Yoga practitioners around the world.  It's a great project to back.  I promise that you'll reap lots of good karma for it.  LOL.  Thank you sooooo much in advance for your contributions!!!  O:-)


OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Spread the word, use your Facebook page and email contacts to help share this info, recommend this project to friends, associates and organizations and send them the link to this Indiegogo campaign page.  You can also send them to my website www.YogaDoctors.com. 

Love, grace and gratitude to you for any assistance you can offer.

Om Shanti Shanti Shanti.

NAMASTE

Dr. Eden Goldman, D.C., E-RYT500, C.Y.T., Y.T.R.X.
www.YogaDoctors.com

story:
Hello my name is Meghan Edwards. 

  On new years eve 2012 I accidentally slipped and fell off a railing two stories high onto concrete. I severely broke my pelvis, sacrum, elbow, and feet. After weeks in the hospital, I've spent the past few months slowly, but steadily, recovering. 

I live in Los Angeles California and I don't have medical insurance. I am a self employed event producer and performance artist.  The accident that has left me in this state took place at my last event on New Years Eve. 

I have dedicated my life to connecting people and to supporting artists and creative minds in any and every way I know how. I thankfully have been very blessed in my endeavors and have yet to need help in any major way, until now.  I'm currently humbly and gratefully in need of any monetary assistance possible. My hospital bills exceed the amount I'm asking by nearly double. In addition I am completely unable to work for the next 3-6 months. 

I am young and although I was constantly working, I run my company alone, and have many expenses, so unfortunately I don't have much in the means of savings. Your contribution will not only help me to eat, keep a roof over my head, but it will also help me take on the debt I now have. 

My hopes are to be able to sustain my life and keep the spirit of communal contribution alive, not only within my local community but also within my heart. Any contribution helps. Even if you cant donate please support by sharing this campaign.

Thank you so much!

 

Blessings and Love,

Meghan Edwards

Miss M.E

story:
About me and this project

I am a Swedish freelancing sports photographer.
Who have been blessed with the opportunity to do a lot of great experiences in my work. 
You can find out more about that here:
 http://photo-it.net/about-english/  
Now i have  been accepted to attend the Sports Shooter Academy.
The Sports Shooter Academy faculty members are some of the best sports photographers that you can find.
You can help me to me to help others, help myself, and fulfill a dream at the same time.
To me, the possibility to help others is a key part while raising the necessary funds to make it become real.
It has been a dream to med for some years to attend the Sports Shooter Academy.
 The reason is that i am yearning to grow as a sports photographer. 
And also to help others to become better in this profession.  
You can help me to achieve something that will have a great positive impact not only to my career, and my future. 
But also help me to help other sport photographers.

What I Need & What You Get

In order to make this possible i need to finance the travel, and special equipment (bags/cases) to protect my photo gear during the flight.  
With your help, you will not only make a dream come true. You will be a part of something that will help others. 

And even more.
There is a possibility for You to both become a part, and take part of it thru my web site dedicated to this project.  
Where i will share things from my journey, together with photography tips. 
http://ssax.photo-it.net/

Companies that back with $75 ore more will have the possibility to have their logo with a link under the "Gold backer" side on the project site.
For companies backing with $150 ore more it will be under the "Platinum backer" side.

If i get more funds then i need for the travel, i will invest it in ways that will benifit to the professional photographers comunity in the long run.

If i wont reach my goal, all funds will be returned.

The Impact

You can help me to achieve something that will have a great positive impact not only to my career, and my future. 
But also help me to help other sport photographers.

Other Ways You Can Help

Money is not the only way to help me! 
All kind of help to spread the word about this project is most velcome.
 And will also have a important impact to make this project become real. 
Using the sharing tools belov will for shure make a difference.

story:
Hello my name is Chris Beeler and I am trying to help my friend Thomas Edward Fisher who has been in the hospital since May 27th with a horrible infection and without insurance.

 

My dear friend Ed has been in Ocala Regional Medical Center in Ocala, Florida (where Ed has lived for the last 7 years) for almost 60 days, and of those 60 days over 45 of them have been in the ICU. As you can imagine his medical bills are Astronomical!!!   This past week, in order to get the infection under control, the doctors had to make the tough call to amputate his right leg all the way up to his hip. They did the surgery on Saturday (July 21st) and he is in good spirits. His mother has been by his side in Florida for much of this time (flying back and forth between Pittsburgh and Florida), however, she is going to be returning to Pittsburgh this weekend due to her responsibilities here. She will continue to fly back and forth as needed but this too is an added expense. They would love to bring him back to PA for rehabilitation but without insurance this seems impossible!

 

I am trying to raise enough money for him to be transported back home to Elizabeth, PA where he can be with his family and rehabilitate.  The reason I want to help bring Ed back to Elizabeth, PA is because all of his family is here.  His mother, father as well as his brothers and sisters all still live in his hometown.  He will get all the emotional support he needs from having them nearby but will still need financial help.  Getting him home to Elizabeth is the first step, but I would also like to try and help defray the cost of the hospital bills as well as the cost of his rehabilitation, which are/will be insurmountable. He still has a very, very long road ahead of him and he is very weak.  His medical care will not stop with him healing from the amputation but he will now need either a prosthetic leg or a wheelchair - neither of which are cheap.

 

Ed has helped so many in our community of Elizabeth, PA.  For those of you who do not know - he was the manager of Grower's Exchange for almost 30 years and gave so many of us our first jobs. Ed has always been very supportive of his community and contributed to various fundraisers while living in Elizabeth, PA.  He was also the police commissioner for Forward Twp. for two terms.

 

I know times are tough for everyone, anything you can contribute will be greatly appreciated. And if you can't contribute monetarily, please help spread the word anyway you can, or just say a prayer.

 

Thank you so much for your time and consideration!

story:
The Nitty Gritty


For everyone that doesn't know me personally, I am Robin. I am a 33 year old single mother, and I am also not the type to ask for help, as I prefer to be self-sufficient...But sometimes we all need to give a little help, and sometimes we all need to get a little help. People who have known me a while know I was in an abusive relationship a few years back. That relationship left me with some fixable physical problems, most of which I've slowly gotten fixed over the years. However, there are some I've not been able to even get started, and now I've reached a point where the issues have become a serious health risk. I used to smile and laugh without reservation quite frequently. Friends used to catch me grinning at them and making funny faces, just because. That hasn't really been true in recent years. Oh, I still laugh, but I also cover my mouth nearly every time. When I left my ex, he got a couple punches to my jaw line before I got out the door. Those parting shots shattered most of my molars, and cracked several other teeth. I can't begin to tell you how much I
a) hate asking for help for this, because I've been unable to take care of it myself, and
b) hate mentioning anything about my teeth...or lack..to anyone.

I used to be quite fond of my smile. Be that as it may.. I searched for organizations to help get back on my feet and help cover necessary medical costs. I found nothing to help until I'd been free of my ex about six months, and then I was told since I wasn't in immediate danger and was already working to get on my feet, they couldn't help me. They could only help women and children who JUST left, or needed help leaving. I was disheartened, but figured I'd do this on my own.

Well, 6 years later, I'm still trying. Most I've handled, as I stated above. However, the costs of the needed dental work and jaw reconstruction are a little more than I can handle alone, even with insurance. This is where you come in, if you decide to help.

My insurance will put a nice dent in the surgery costs, but I still need to cover about $5,000 out of pocket.  And, unfortunately, this has gone on long enough I'm in danger of losing part of my jaw if I don't get it taken care of. I'm at a point where I have tried all avenues presented to me and have not quite been able to meet the financial goals I need to meet to get this done. I guess, when it comes down to it, I'm hoping that all the help I've given over the years comes back to me.

If you can contribute anything, please do. If not, please share. Regardless, thank you for reading, and be well.
